title: Software Developer, Backend - Sectra Medical
description:
Be a part of something that matters
  
  

Do you want to use your technical skills to truly make a difference? At Sectra, we develop innovative IT solutions that improve healthcare and help save lives. We’re looking for a passionate Software Engineer to help us shape the future of medical image technology. Could this be you?
  
  

About the role
  
  

As a Software Engineer at Sectra, you’ll be at the core of our product development. You’ll not only design, code, and test our software but also play a key role in ensuring that our solutions address real problems faced by healthcare professionals every day. Our mission is to deliver systems that are intuitive, scalable, and highly effective.
  
  

Your team
  
  

Our development teams are organized into agile, self-organized groups with a shared passion for technology. Together, we are responsible for the design, implementation, and quality of our products.
  
  

What you'll do
  
  

This role offers a mix of technical challenges and opportunities to work alongside dedicated colleagues. Your key responsibilities include:
  
  

Solving complicated and interesting challenges in our backend using C# and C++.
  
Optimizing our solutions for cloud-native environments, primarily in Microsoft Azure.
  
Designing, managing, and stabilizing SQL databases for reliability and efficiency.
  
Using tools like Visual Studio, Git, and Jira to manage your code and track progress.
  
Ensuring seamless API communication between backend and frontend.
  
Contributing to an inspiring work environment where knowledge-sharing and innovations thrive.
  
  

What we offer
  
  

At Sectra, we want you to feel inspired, supported, and motivated to grow – both personally and professionally. Here’s what you can look forward to:
  
  

An inspiring work environment – A culture filled with energy, passion, and a shared mission to create impact through technology.
  
Cutting-edge technology – Work with the latest tools and technologies while pioneering new solutions.
  
Opportunities for growth – Every day is a chance to learn, develop, and challenge yourself.
  
Team spirit – You’ll work with brilliant peers who value collaboration just as much as innovation.
  
Fun and balance – We believe in working hard, but also having fun. Together, we celebrate victories and support each other.
  
  

Life at Sectra
  
  

The work put into our solutions is prioritized by our own and ideas from customers and stakeholder at Sectra. However, we want and encourage all our employees to explore their own ideas. For example, every six weeks, a two day “RAD-Friday” is arranged where all our engineers have the opportunity to work on their own ideas. Ideas that often are incorporated into our products.
  
  

We can guarantee you a challenging and rewarding position, and as a software developer at Sectra, you will for sure get to spend lots of time with your hands on the keyboard implementing smart solutions. On top of that, you will also:
  
  

Get a mentor to enable a smooth onboarding
  
Work with highly skilled co-workers
  
Contribute to better healthcare for millions of patients worldwide
  
Be part of learning journey – we have a continuous drive to learn and excel
  
Have fun!
  
Work with great people
  
SOFIA ADOLFSSON
  
UX Designer
  
"There is no sense of prestige at Sectra, no hierarchy. Everyone is listened to regardless of their position."
  
ADAM ALSEGÅRD
  
Software Engineer
  
"I believe Sectra is a great company, with the possibility for personal growth."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

At Sectra, we hire for attitude and ability – train for skill. This means who you are is more important than your previous experiences. There are a few core abilities that are central for any role. We always look for your willingness and ability to learn and take on new tasks fast, utilize previous experiences and quickly grasp new information. We also want you to have a strong analytical mindset in which we consider it to be important that you can understand and break down and solve problems. We also want you to be a good communicator where you have the ability to interact with colleagues, partners and customers in a effective, clear and constructive way.
  
  

**In addition to these abilities, we also want you to:**  

Have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree within engineering, IT or similar with a strong academic record
  
Have a strong interest in new and innovative technology and software development
  
Be fluent in Swedish and English, both verbally and written
  
Value customer contact and thrive in a fast-paced technological environment
  
  

**We consider it a great asset if you:**  

Have experience of software development in agile technologies
  
Speak more languages than those required above
  
Have interests besides school/work, such as sports, sports leader, music, horseback riding singing or flying for example
  
Don't like to sit in unnecessary meetings, we prefer to think and develop software
  
  

**Other information:**  

The goal is for the right candidate to start as possible.
  
  

We recruit on an ongoing basis. This means we encourage you to apply or contact us as soon as possible.
  
  

Depending on the role, a mandatory background security screening might be performed as part of the recruitment process at Sectra. Please reach out to the responsible hiring team if you have any questions regarding this.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Making a difference
  
  

Great colleagues
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Innovation & technology
  
  

Global environment
  
  

Working close to customers
  
  

About the company
  
  

Sectra develops and sells cutting-edge solutions for medical IT and cybersecurity. We help hospitals and those who are training future healthcare personnel to improve their efficiency so that patients can receive better care. We also support and help defense, authorities, and critical social functions to secure their communication against eavesdropping and protect their systems against unauthorized access. This is how we create conditions for a healthier and safer society.
  
  

One thing that identifies us at Sectra is our customer obsession— our ability and willingness to understand, create value for and stand up for our customers. This shared priority is at the core of our culture. Our customers describe this as having the knowledge to meet expectations, the passion to exceed them. As we hire for attitude and ability - train for skill, we happily expand your knowledge, if you bring the passion and willingness to learn.
  
  

Claes Fälth | Contact Person
company_description: The company was founded in 1978, has its head office in Linköping with subsidiaries in 19 countries and operates through partners worldwide.

title: Senior FileMaker-utvecklare
description:
*Vi söker en senior FileMaker-utvecklare för att förstärka vårt gäng! Hos oss får du möjlighet att bygga och utveckla din talang. Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling med Claris Filemaker.*


### **Om oss**



Hos oss är personlig utveckling, frihet och arbetsglädje lika viktigt som ansvarskänsla och teamwork. Vi arbetar tillsammans och kontorsövergripande enligt agila metoder för att uppnå våra mål och tackla utmaningar gemensamt.



Idag är vi ett växande team om ca 25 medarbetare som lotsar våra kunder i deras digitaliseringsresa. Vi har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm och Malmö och vi blandar kontorsnärvaro med distansarbete efter individuella behov och förutsättningar.



Vi vet av erfarenhet att organisationer lyckas bättre med IT-stöd som följsamt och säkert anpassas till förändring och nya utmaningar. Vårt mål är att “Skapa tid för det som är viktigt” för de tusentals användare som använder våra lösningar. Detta gör vi genom att erbjuda smarta och kundanpassade lösningar.



Vi jobbar både med egen produktutveckling såväl som kundunika uppdrag som leder till skräddarsydda applikationer för våra kunder. Huvuddelen av vår utveckling sker med hjälp av FileMaker från Claris, men vi har även ett team av webbutvecklare och erfarna driftstekniker.


### **Om tjänsten**



Som en av våra månfarare jobbar du dagligen nära dina erfarna kollegor och med våra gemensamma kunder.



Hos oss jobbar du brett och omväxlande med bland annat utveckling, behovsanalys, databassystemering, integrationer, automatisering och UI/UX.



I detta fall söker vi i första hand en medarbetare i Stockholm.


### **Om dig**



För att trivas i tjänsten tror vi att du har jobbat några år som FileMaker-utvecklare. Kompletterande erfarenhet av webbutveckling ser vi som positivt.



Vi ser framför oss att du:


* Har flera års erfarenhet av att jobba med utveckling med FileMaker
* Arbetar bäst som del av ett team
* Gillar att skriva kod som andra förstår
* Är ansvarstagande och hjälpsam
* Behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Är bekväm med att jobba både på kontor och på distans

### **Det formella**


**Anställningsvillkor**  

Heltid. Månadslön.


**Arbetsgivare**  

Square Moon AB, 556549-3292


**Ansökan**  

Känns detta som en tjänst för dig? Skicka in din ansökan nedan redan idag så kontaktar vi dig så snart som möjligt. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatumet.

title: Senior Diagnostics Function Developer
description:
Design it, build it, test it, see your design come to life and be part of the electromobility revolution!

 **This is us, your new colleagues**


We at Electromobility are taking the heritage of best-in-class conventional products and turn that into environmentally friendly and sustainable top-notch electrical products. The responsibility of our group is to develop diagnostics software, keep together and define the diagnostics software strategy in electromobility.

  

The Electromobility department combines the benefits of a large international company with the feeling of working at a small company. There is close collaboration between different parts of the organization from sales and purchasing to workshops and labs all located in the modern, inspiring facility CampX. We believe that teamwork and collaboration are the foundation of great products and an attractive workplace.

  

We are approximately 15 highly skilled professionals in our group, who share a passion for technology and developing products that make a difference for the Volvo Group’s customers and society.

  

We trust the individual and act as a team, we always have the customer in focus, and we want to deliver high quality products. Together with us you will get interesting opportunities for professional and personal growth. We believe that teamwork and collaboration are the foundation for great products and an attractive workplace.

  

The expectations are high, and therefore we need to get you on board to further strengthen our capacity. We are expanding with a new position as a Diagnostics Software Function Developer to further strengthen our team.

 **What You'll Do:**  

* Develop and implement cutting-edge diagnostics software for electric propulsion systems.
* Test and analyze the functionality of your software and troubleshoot as needed.
* Conduct data analytics for follow-ups on developed functionality.
* Collaborate closely with colleagues across various teams to optimize diagnostics strategies.
 **Who are you?**


You're analytical, a problem-solver, and a tech enthusiast eager to learn. With a focus on solutions, you bring a can-do attitude to challenges, working well both independently and in teams.

 **Qualifications:**  

* Master’s or bachelor’s in engineering or related field.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).
* 4+ years of experience in at least two of these areas:


o On Board Diagnostics (OBD) development.  

o Embedded software development (C, MATLAB/Simulink).  

o Electric propulsion systems.  

  

**Merits:**  

* Experience in AutoSar, Targetlink, Python, Jira, GIT, Canalyzer, ATI Vision.
* CAN-communication
* On Board Diagnostic legal requirements
  

Are you curious and have some questions? Contact me!


I will gladly give you more information about the position and how we can team up to electrify tomorrow!

**Hiring Manager:** Johan Engbom, Manager Electrical Propulsion System Diagnostics  

**Email id:** johan.engbom@volvo.com  

LinkeIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/johan-engbom-205817135/

  

Last Application Date: 21st Feb

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Cobol developer to Accounting Solutions \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
At SEB, Team EKOT is dedicated to maintaining and managing the bank’s daily accounting operations. We work in an agile environment, ensuring the smooth running and continuous improvement of our financial systems.  

We are now recruiting a skilled COBOL Developer to join our dynamic team. As a member of Team EKOT, you will be responsible for both the maintenance and development of our core financial booking applications. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that meet the evolving needs of our business. Our system setup is mainly Mainframe applications where we are part of the consolidating and reporting flow to our end consumers in Finance. The team is a 13 headed multi-cultural group of highly skilled developers. We are in the initial phases of implementing the future roadmap where integration and gradual migrations will be both challenging and rewarding.
### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop, test, and maintain COBOL programs for our financial systems.
* Collaborate with team members to design and implement new features.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing applications.
* Participate in agile ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices.
* Interest in developing your own technical skills in a changing environment.

### **The ideal candidate:**

* Proven experience as a COBOL Developer.
* Strong interest in learning banking and financial systems.
* Experience working in an agile environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team setting.
* Good communication skills in English.

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-02-19. If you have questions about the position, please contact Team Manager Patrik Schwalbe at patrik.schwalbe@seb.se or 070-6393334, but we will not process applications via email.  

  

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.

Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Senior Systemutvecklare (Tech Lead)
description:
Vill du utveckla framtidens digitala lärplattformar? Ett ledande utbildningsinstitut söker nu en erfaren och kreativ systemutvecklare för att förbättra och vidareutveckla dess egenutvecklade lärplattform. Här får du chansen att arbeta med teknik som gör skillnad för tusentals elever och lärare i en miljö med komplexa och stora system. Som Tech Lead får du möjlighet att ta ägandeskap över den tekniska riktningen och säkerställa att utvecklingen håller hög kvalitet och följer bästa praxis. Du blir en nyckelperson i teamet och arbetar nära projektledare för att driva initiativ från idé till färdig lösning.

 **Vi söker dig som har:**

* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora och komplexa system, gärna inom utbildningssektorn eller liknande branscher.
* Förmåga att hantera utmaningar inom prestanda, skalbarhet och systemintegrationer.
* Erfarenhet av att axla en tech lead-roll och arbeta nära projektledare för att driva utvecklingsprocesser framåt.

**För rätt person erbjuder vi:**

* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och förutsättningar att växa både i yrkesrollen och som person.
* En arbetsplats på företagets huvudkontor präglad av stark och professionell företagskultur, teamkänsla och med stort eget ansvar.
* En miljö med fokus på utveckling och kvalitet i ett entreprenörsdrivet familjeföretag.

Teamet arbetar agilt(Scrum) och nära verksamheten vilket kräver att du trivs med teamwork och kunskapsdelning. Du behöver ha god kommunikationsförmåga, ta ansvar och fungera i en föränderlig miljö. Kreativitet, lösningsfokus och ett strukturerat arbetssätt är viktigt.

 **Kompetenskrav:**

* Backend: PHP/Laravel.
* Databas: MySQL.
* Verktyg: Jira, Git, Bitbucket.
* API:er och systemintegrationer.
* Svenska och Engelska - tal och skrift.

**Meriterande kunskaper:**

* Frontend: Angular.
* NodeJS, Express, TypeScript.
* React Native för iOS/Android.
* Feature Flags med LaunchDarkly.
* Containerisering, molntjänster, penetrationstester, serverinfrastruktur.

 **Start: Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid**

 **Ansökan:**


Vårt Talent Acquisition-team ser gärna att du som söker har goda referenser samt ett välarbetat CV som specificerar tidigare erfarenheter och utbildning inom området. Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt, då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter, eftersom vi vet att mångfald berikar och stärker vårt arbete. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt system. Vid frågor, kontakta maria@linden-it.se.

title: Python developer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
The Connectors team focuses on seamlessly fetching marketing data from different platforms.


We unify this data to ensure it’s readily accessible and actionable for marketers through the dashboard. With over 280 connectors, the team ensures each one functions reliably out of the box for our customers.


We are looking for a consultant to help drive the transition of our connector platform to a


declarative approach.


By adopting a declarative approach using YAML, we aim to simplify and standardize connector configurations, allowing teams to define desired states in a clean, human-readable format. This will enable us to move faster, reduce errors, and improve testability and scalability as the platform grows.


The role will involve collaborating closely with the team to design and implement this new


configuration system. The goal is to establish a mature, user-friendly platform that internal


teams can easily adopt.

**In order to contribute to this initiative we think that you:**

* +6 years of experience in working with Python development
* Have a clear understanding of the development life cycle, including automated testing,
* CI/CD and continuous deliveries with high quality
* Hands-on experience building API integrations between different platforms to ensure smooth data flow and functionality.
* Comfortable working with large datasets, optimizing pipelines, ensuring data quality, and using the right tools to handle big data efficiently.
* Familiar with test-driven development and writing clean, testable code. You’re comfortable building tests and letting them guide your development to create reliable, high-quality software.
* Experience working with agile methodologies and team-based workflows. You’re comfortable collaborating with fellow engineers, adapting to change, and keeping initiatives moving smoothly to completion.
* Experience in improving engineering practices and processes.
* An overall strong communicator and fluent English.
* Nice to have: Experience with Infrastructure as Code in AWS.  

  

**For this role our client is looking for someone who can work onsite 5 days/week in Stockholm. The length of the contract will be for 6 months with a possibility to extend.**

title: Systemutvecklare till Kommuninvest
description:
***"Välkommen till Kommuninvest – där din tekniska kunskap driver samhällsnytta framåt."***


Kommuninvest är Sveriges ledande långivare till kommuner och regioner. Med ett tydligt samhällsengagemang och en stark ambition att bidra till hållbar utveckling skapar Kommuninvest ekonomiska förutsättningar för investeringar i allt från skolor och vårdinrättningar till klimatåtgärder och infrastrukturlösningar. Genom samarbete och innovation erbjuder de kommuner och regioner moderna verktyg för att hantera sina finanser effektivt.


Under de kommande tre åren genomgår Kommuninvest en spännande transformation av sitt affärssystem och du kommer att vara en viktig länk i denna resa. Här får du inte bara bygga system – du får vara med och skapa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad på samhällsnivå!

**Fredrika Norman, Gruppchef IT, säger:**  

*"Vi står inför en fantastisk möjlighet att inte bara förnya våra system utan att också ta ett stort kliv in i framtiden med molnbaserade lösningar. Här på Kommuninvest är vi stolta över att kombinera teknik med samhällsnytta, och vi söker nu en driven systemutvecklare som vill vara med och forma den framtiden."*

**Om rollen**


Som systemutvecklare blir du en central del av utvecklingsteamet, där dina tekniska visioner förvandlas till verklighet. Rollen innebär att arbeta i en modern teknisk miljö som präglas av innovation, säkerhet och användarvänlighet. Du kommer att bidra till att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad för användarna och samtidigt stöder Kommuninvests samhällsnyttiga uppdrag.

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla och optimera system med hjälp av C#, JavaScript och TypeScript.
* Utveckla och implementera lösningar i Azure-miljö.
* Delta i kravhantering och skapa intuitiva användarupplevelser.
* Översätta verksamhetskrav till funktionell systemdesign och implementera dem.
* Kontinuerligt förbättra teamets arbetsprocesser.
* Säkerställa hög kodkvalitet genom kodgranskning, scanning och automatiska tester.
* Förvalta och vidareutveckla befintliga system.

***Detta är en värdefull möjlighet att vara en del av en arbetsplats där ditt arbete bidrar till att stärka det svenska samhället. Låter det som rätt utmaning för dig? Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan!***

**Kommuninvest erbjuder:**

* Möjlighet att arbeta på distans: En arbetsmiljö som främjar flexibilitet och tillgänglighet.
* Fokus på hållbar utveckling: Kommuninvest investerar i både din personliga och professionella utveckling.
* Balans i livet: Flexibla möjligheter att kombinera arbete, fritid och familjeliv.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Bidrag för att främja din hälsa och ditt välmående.

**Är du den vi söker?**


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom IT eller programmering.
* Erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling med C# och JavaScript.
* Kunskap om molnbaserade lösningar i Azure och serverless-teknologier.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och DevOps.
* Vana att arbeta agilt, exempelvis enligt Scrum.
* Erfarenhet av systemtestning och integrationsutveckling.


Som systemutvecklare är du en kreativ och kvalitetsmedveten person med ett stort intresse för ny teknik och nya arbetssätt. Du är inte bara tekniskt skicklig, du är en lagspelare som förstår vikten av kommunikation och samarbete. Du är proaktiv, anpassningsbar och har en naturlig förmåga att ta ansvar. Du är prestigelös och motiveras av att vara problemlösaren för dina kollegor. Du delar företagets värderingar och är redo att bidra till en kultur som präglas av öppenhet, kundfokus och hållbarhet.

**Information och ansökan**


I denna rekrytering har Kommuninvest valt att samarbeta med AxÖ Consulting. Alla ansökningar behandlas konfidentiellt. För frågor om uppdraget, vänligen kontakta rekryteringskonsult: Oskar Bernling, 073-915 70 61, alternativt via mail oskar.bernling@axoconsulting.se


Urval sker löpande och tillsättning kan komma att ske innan sista ansökningsdag.

***För tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap, i enlighet med de säkerhetsskyddsbestämmelser som gäller för rollen.***


AxÖ Consulting AB har lång och gedigen erfarenhet från rekryterings- och konsultbranschen och har arbetat med såväl privat marknad som inom offentlig sektor. För mer information och ansökan besök www.axoconsulting.se. Vi tar tyvärr inte emot ansökningar via brev eller e-post. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.

title: Java utvecklare
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Utveckla dina färdigheter - väx med oss! Spännande tider på Sigma Technology Digital Solutions! Därför söker vi fler kollegor som vill ansluta sig till oss, som är lika nyfikna som vi på att skapa innovativa IT-lösningar med fokus på digital tillgänglighet och inkludering. Vår ambition är att tänka om utvecklingsprocessen genom att göra tillgänglighet till en hörnsten i varje digitaliseringsresa - oavsett om vi pratar om användarvänlighet eller programvaruutveckling.



*Nyfiken på att gå med?*



Som anställd på Sigma Technology Digital Solutions erbjuder vi dig en säker anställning med intressanta och utmanande arbetsmöjligheter. Du kan påverka din karriärväg genom olika agila utvecklingsmetoder och arbeta nära kunden för att leverera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar värde och främjar deras framgång.  

Tack vare vårt utvidgade kundnätverk som verkar i olika branscher med en variation av uppdrag att välja mellan, kommer det alltid att finnas nya utmaningar tillgängliga!



*Vad blir din nästa utmaning?*



### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker nu Javautvecklare till kunder i Göteborg. Hos Sigma Technology Digital Solutions arbetar du i en dynamisk miljö där vi samarbetar med kollegor som är verksamma inom olika sektorer och branscher, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.



Du är nyfiken, intresserad av teknologi och ivrig att fortsätta lära dig. Som person är du ansvarstagande, lösningsorienterad och tycker om att samarbeta med kunder såväl som kollegor. För denna roll ser vi gärna att du är flytande i svenska, då det underlättar kommunikation och samarbete med våra kunder och team.


### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Starka programmeringskunskaper i Java/J2EE technologies: JavaScript, JQuery, XML, JSPs, etc.
* SQL-databas
* Git
* Agil utveckling
* .Net Core (inte nödvändigt men en fördel)
* Flytande i svenska (tal och skrift).

### **WE OFFER**



Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och tveka inte att kontakta mig om du har några frågor! Uppfyller du inte alla kriterier? Kontakta mig ändå - vi letar efter olika talanger att växa med!



### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Andreas Sandberg,  

+46 790607160  

andreas.sandberg@sigmatechnology.com

Java utvecklare

title: BI Developer
description:
Dole Nordic AB är en av de ledande aktörerna inom frukt- och grönsaksbranschen. Vi brinner för att leverera hållbara och hälsosamma produkter till våra kunder och konsumenter. Med fokus på kvalitet, innovation och hållbarhet arbetar vi för att förbättra hela leveranskedjan från jord till bord. Nu söker vi en engagerad och driven BI Developer till vårt kontor i Helsingborg!


Om rollen


Som BI Developer på Dole Nordic kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förbättra vår datahantering och beslutsstöd. Du kommer att arbeta med att bygga och optimera ETL-flöden samt utveckla rapporter och applikationer i QlikView/Qlik Sense. Din insats kommer att hjälpa oss att förstå och analysera vår verksamhet bättre, vilket stödjer vårt arbete med att skapa en effektivare och mer hållbar utveckling framöver.


Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter

* Skapa och vidareutveckla rapporter och applikationer i främst Qlik Sense.
* Implementera tekniska lösningar som stöder analytikernas behov av data.
* Designa, utveckla och underhålla ETL-flöden för att säkerställa korrekta och aktuella dataflöden.
* Säkerställa hög datakvalitet och utveckla lösningar för datavalidering och kvalitetssäkring.
* Samarbeta med olika avdelningar för att förstå deras behov och översätta dessa till tekniska lösningar.
* Identifiera möjligheter för förbättringar i dataflöden och beslutsstödsverktygen.


Om dig


Vi söker dig som är analytisk, tekniskt kunnig och har en stark drivkraft att skapa effektiva lösningar. Du är en lagspelare med god förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta över olika avdelningar inom Dole Nordic.


För att ta sig an rollen som BI Developer hos oss tror vi att det behövs en relevant högskoleutbildning inom exempelvis IT, statistik, dataanalys eller likvärdig kunskap. Du behöver behärska svenska och engelska, erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera ETL-lösningar samt BI-lösningar i t.ex. QlikView/Qlik Sense. Vidare är kunskap inom SQL och datamodellering önskvärda.


Har du dessutom arbetat med datainsamling från ERP-system så som t.ex. Infor M3, hanterat och optimerat SQL-frågor samt skapat avancerade SQL-skript och har kunskap om andra BI-verktyg så som t.ex. Power BI är det meriterande.


Vi erbjuder


En spännande roll i ett företag som sätter stort värde på hållbarhet och innovation. Du har möjlighet att påverka och forma hur vi arbetar med data och beslutsstöd. Här bryr vi oss om varandra och värderar samarbete och gemenskap högt. Vi har dessutom många generösa förmåner och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter.


Ansök i dag


Ansök gärna i dag, då urval sker löpande! Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta IT Development Manager, Christer Wahlberg, christer.wahlberg@dolenordic.com.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!


Om företaget


Dole Nordic är Nordens största frukt- och grönsaksföretag. Vi odlar, köper, förädlar, förpackar, marknadsför, säljer, fraktar och optimerar logistiken kring frukt, grönsaker och bär från hela världen.


Inom Dole Nordic-familjen ingår bland annat Everfresh och Interbanan i Sverige och Lembcke och Nordic Fruit i Danmark. Totalt är vi ca 900 medarbetare i Norden och omsätter ca 9 miljarder SEK. Våra huvudkontor ligger i Helsingborg, Sverige, respektive Köge, Danmark.


Som Dole Nordic är vi också en del av Dole plc, global marknadsledare inom färska frukter och grönsaker. Med vårt breda kontaktnät av leverantörer runt om i världen kan vi förse nordiska och europeiska kunder inom detaljhandel, restaurang- och grossistsektorn samt offentlig verksamhet med färska frukter och grönsaker året runt.


För mer information om oss, se gärna: www.dolenordic.com.

title: Sales Systems Manager / Salesforce Developer
description:
**Role Description:**  

As a Sales Systems Manager at HVD Group, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of all our Salesforce applications, and project managing the development our extended portfolio of Sales Systems. Your role will therefore cover a number of different areas, and systems, primarily around the development of our Salesforce ecosystem, including defining the prioritizations and roadmap for development across our systems landscape. The extended sales applications you would be responsible for include among others CPQ, e-signature, market intelligence, a subscription management system, a calendar booking application, various applications being integrated through Zapier, etc, as part of our continuously growing, and evolving systems landscape.
  
  

Having been recently acquired by one of the worlds biggest Private Equity firms, HVD Group is going through a rapid growth journey both organically, and through acquisitions, with ambitious growth targets over the upcoming years, and is therefore looking to rapidly scale up its systems landscape accordingly. This role is therefore critical to ensuring we keep our systems landscape state of the art in order to facilitate the continued growth and changes that we are undergoing. We are therefore looking for someone comfortable with continuous change, and who is continuously looking for new ways to improve efficiency, and to bring added value to our organization.
  
  

As part of your role, you would be providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices as we scale out our systems landscape. At times, this will include working with, and managing external consultants, and vendors in the integrations, and developments of HVD Group’s sales systems. You will be heavily engaged with various teams and stakeholders across the organization, where having a collaborative, and problem solving attitude, and an ability to manage many ongoing priorities will be essential, along with an ability to ensure continuous timely deliveries.
  
  

If you enjoy a high paced environment, continuously working on new projects, and processes, and are looking to be part of an incredible growth journey, then we look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Collaboration: Partner with business stakeholders in Sales, GTM, Marketing and Customer Success to proactively identify, drive, and build improvements and scalable system solutions that solve business needs.
* Salesforce Development: Maintain, and manage a prioritized roadmap for the future developments, and integrations required in Salesforce. Conduct all business requirements gathering, documentation, development and testing; and where required leverage external Salesforce consultants or other solution experts. Ensure stakeholders are continuously updated on timelines and expectations for delivery.
* Budget management: Manage the budgets for systems licenses requirements, in alignment with the leadership teams, and finance as part of annual budgeting process. Provide business cases for any new, additional systems requirements.
* Vendor relationships: Maintain all IT vendor relationships, including managing vendor selections, benchmarking, and negotiations (in alignment with management and IT)
* Team leadership: Manage 1 direct report, consisting of a Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst, ensuring they are delivering quality work in a timely manner, and are continuously updating and communicating with stakeholders on timelines, prioritizations, status’s etc.
* Continuous Improvement: Work to improve existing Salesforce infrastructure and implement new features and functionality according to best practices. Use data and results to proactively seek out opportunities for improvement and enhancement of our current systems and processes.


**Skills and Qualifications required:**  

* A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
* At least 8 years of Sales Systems Management experience. This must include at least 5 years of experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud.
* Proven experience as a Salesforce developer, including a strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, its architecture, and its limitations.
* Big plus would be if you have a Salesforce Architect background.
* Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce development tools.
* Knowledge of web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
* Salesforce developer certifications, such as Platform Developer I and II, are highly essential, with a Salesforce Architect certification highly preferred.
* License and budget management – ideally have a background managing budgets for licenses, and costs.


**Role location:**  

While we would prefer the role to be located at our Group HQ in Stockholm, we are open to hiring remotely, or based out of our regional offices, including among others, Oslo, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Berlin, Manchester, or Linköping.
  
  

**Travel:**  

Travel will be limited in this role, but will at times be required for project planning purposes, and execution of larger systems migrations or other systems implementations, in addition to team events.
  
  

About the company
  
  

HVD Group is developing rapidly and is working hard to conquer the European market on software for craftsmen. We are a team of over 500 people in multiple locations working locally and globally to achieve our mission. Our teams are changing the industry and improving the everyday life of thousands of workers and businesses - from the family-owned to enterprise customers.
  
  

Through innovative technology and years of expertise in the craftmanship industry, we have successfully partner with over 10,000 customer and gained trust of 100,000 users in different segments of the industry. Our vision is to become the European leader in providing business systems for the craftsmen industry. To accomplish this ambitious goal, we need to continue building our teams with strong talent, like yourself.
  
  

Jessica Ögren | Contact Person

title: Senior Software Engineer - .Net Developer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About Us**
------------


At Volvo Group Digital & IT, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. We have a very important role to play in reaching the Volvo Group ambitions for 2030. Do you want to be part of our transformation journey towards becoming the digital capability of the Group? The time is now.

**This will be us - your colleagues within Digital Delivery**
-------------------------------------------------------------


Digital Delivery is a new function within Volvo Group Digital & IT. It has the ambition to identify and execute on new digital initiatives in tight collaboration with TD/BAs and Group Functions as well as modernize and transform our existing solutions into products and to secure agile ways of working across the whole Digital Delivery function.  

Together with our digital talents, we will work on solution design and deliveries to improve business performance and create value at scale for Volvo Group. Included in our mission is to drive an efficient Volvo Group Digital & IT interface and Portfolio Management for the TD/BAs and Group Functions.  

  

We collaborate with other parts of the organization, both in Volvo Group Digital & IT, with TD/BAs and Group Functions. We foster an environment where ideas, thoughts and opinions can be shared. We are team players with clear common ambitions, and we win together.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You are passionate about engineering best practices, advocating for clean code, and automating routine tasks. Comfortable working in agile environments, embracing change and continuous improvement. Your transparent, committed, and reliable nature builds trust among colleagues and customers. You have a strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies, thriving in a changing world. Possessing excellent design and problem-solving skills is second nature to you. Proficiency in English is a requirement, and you're used to or enthusiastic about working in an international environment. You have the ability to work in a changing environment and demonstrate a strong team spirit while being interested in understanding business processes.


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, you will bring:

 **Your experiences**

* Proficient in the .NET platform, with a focus on backend systems and microservices
* Strong Understanding on how to work with S.O.L.I.D principles, Design Patterns. Writing Clean Code and refactoring.
* Skilled in designing and implementing GraphQL and RESTful services.
* Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO)
* Knowledgeable and experienced in working with relational databases, particularly MS SQL Server.
* Experienced with Azure DevOps and GIT for version control and CI/CD workflows.

 **Nice to have**

* Knowledge on Event streaming platform like Azure Event Hub, Kafka
* Knowledge on security and vulnerabilities
* Well-versed in unit testing, integration testing, and Test-Driven Development (TDD).
* Knowledge with front-end development languages like Angular, React or another modern JavaScript framework
* Proficient in speaking and writing Swedish and English.

 **Your Mission If You Accept It**

* Write clean, testable, scalable code using .NET programming languages
* Always be up to date with technological developments and be proactive about the developments to be implemented to avoid any risk of technical debt.
* Review and refactor code
* Implementing business logic and developing APIs and services
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:

* Emphasis on work-life balance for personal and professional development
* Immersive experience in an agile and international DevSecOps environment
* Abundant growth and career opportunities
* Potential to work globally or cross-functionally
* Regular interactions within the team
* Close collaboration with Volvo Trucks Aftermarket IT and business teams
* Attractive work environment fostering collaboration on business-critical solutions
* Friendly atmosphere with highly skilled colleagues
* Strong and experienced team driven by teamwork and mutual improvement
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you are curious to explore how we put our words into actions, follow us on LinkedIn and volvogroup.com.

**Have questions? Call us!**  

Contacts:  

Hiring Manager - Mukul Keshari, mukul.keshari@volvo.com

***Please note: Don’t wait until the last date to submit your application, as interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.***

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: Frontendutvecklare
description:
Försäkring handlar om livet, och allt handlar om IT. I vårt team kommer du att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som har kraften att förvandla olyckor till möjligheter, och drömmar till verklighet. Vi använder intressant teknik för att skapa ledande försäkringsupplevelser för våra kunder. Ge dem tryggheten och självförtroendet att vara nyfikna, utforska nya världar, starta nya företag och leva sina liv.
Om rollen
I din roll som Frontendutvecklare kommer du vara med och påverka hur framtidens lösningar för skadehantering ser ut. Du kommer att ha dagliga möten med ditt team där vi gärna diskuterar arkitektur, vad som är bra kod och best practices ihop. Självklart har vi CI/CD. Teamet arbetar med Kanban i Azure DevOps. Utöver ditt samarbete med teamet kommer du även ha täta dialoger med affärsutvecklare eller användare för att utveckla något nytt kring automatisering av skador eller för att göra våra befintliga system mer effektiva för våra kunder. Som en del av vårt team kommer du att ha möjlighet att arbeta med spännande projekt och bidra till att skapa robusta och effektiva systemlösningar.
Vad du kommer att göra* Utveckla högkvalitativa lösningar baserat på If´s referensarkitektur.
* Vara delaktig i att utveckla hur vi jobbar kring skalbarhet, kodkvalité och best practices.
* Förstå befintliga system och deras komponenter för att identifiera möjligheter till förbättring och effektivisering.
* Kommunicera med kollegor, användare och stakeholders.

Du kommer arbeta i en spännande roll med ett varierande arbete som ställer stora krav på eget ansvar samtidigt som det givetvis alltid går att be om hjälp från dina kompetenta kollegor.
Vi erbjuder
På samma sätt som vi ställer höga krav på dig som medarbetare, förväntar vi oss att du ställer höga krav på oss som arbetsgivare. Här är några av våra förmåner på If:* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna
* Goda karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter på Nordens största försäkringsbolag
* Sociala aktiviteter och en ytterst professionell miljö
* Möjlighet till hybrid workplace
* Hälsofrämjande arbetsplats med t.ex. friskvårdsbidrag och idrottsaktiviteter
* Goda försäkringsförmåner
* Lunchförmån
* Mycket god tjänstepensionsplan


Om teamet
Vi är ett team som i dagsläget består av ca 12 medarbetare med olika bakgrund som förenas i vårt engagemang för tech och att lösa problem!
I vårt team utmanar vi varandra men delar också kunskap och erfarenheter så att vi kan växa. Vi har en transparent kultur och respekterar varandras åsikter och hjälper varandra att lyckas med våra uppgifter. Att ha kul på jobbet ser vi helt enkelt som en förutsättning för att kunna bli ännu bättre på det vi gör. Vi arbetar med roliga och utmanande projekt och har en stor möjlighet till att vara med och påverka framtidens digitala lösningar men också vårt uppdrag.
Vem är du
Du är en person som har ett stort intresse för systemutveckling och kunskaper i C# och .NET och att arbeta agilt. Du är skicklig inom frontend och delar gärna med dig av dina erfarenheter till teamet. Du har en relevant utbildning från högskola eller universitet.
Du har :* Minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av React eller liknande ramverk för webbutveckling
* Det är bekvämt för dig att kommunicera med kollegor och användare på både svenska och engelska

Övrig information och rekryteringsprocessen

Uppstart: Enligt överenskommelse.

title: Software Developer - Analytics Solutions
description:
Job Title
Software Developer - Analytics Solutions
Job Description*Axis devices shine in the hands of creative developers! The analytics solutions that we offer make our cameras and other devices leading stars of systems and use cases. Join our team and make them shine even brighter!*  

Your future team  

We are one of the teams responsible for enchanting our device portfolio with analytics powers. With computer vision algorithms on top of deep-learning accelerated hardware we solve customer use-cases the edge devices e.g. network cameras. We address a variety of customer challenges ranging from security breaches, with intrusion detection, to operational efficiency with trend and movement analysis.
If you want a sneak peak of what we are doing, check it out here!  

We strongly believe in collaboration, exchange of knowledge and having fun together. We are a diverse team regarding personalities, skills and years in the business. The team is somewhere between 10-15 engineers where we typically work in smaller groups to get faster iterations and seamless collaboration. The scope for the team is both frontend and backend code, making us self-sufficient in taking on a full user problem.  

What will you do?
As a member in the team, you will be key in our journey going forward as a strong contributor in all aspects of the craftsmanship of software engineering. We always aim for code fit-for-purpose throughout the full software lifecycle so you can expect being able to add your voice to these types of discussions.
More specifically we need your experience and skills in C++ and Linux, but as the awesome engineer you are, we think you are open to new technologies and ready to learn what is needed to build some great software.
Since we are heavily involved and dependent on machine learning and deep learning algorithms it would be great if you have some understanding of those concepts.
What will you do?  

As a person you are confident in your professional role. You are trustworthy and your word is highly respected. You love sharing knowledge and help the team to win. Innovation and time to create something new is dear to you, and something you think should be included in every day's work.
We work in small agile teams with high self-sufficiency. This means the level of freedom is high, but also the level of responsibility. You will most likely have experience from similar team setups and thrive where your voice is heard, you have a lot of influence and where you take ownership of the code from all aspects.  

Who am I, your future manager?  

I truly believe in setting teams and individuals up for success, my mission is to make you and the team the best there is. I think leadership is for everyone, which leads to teams and individuals taking great ownership of what they do. What I add to the equation is guidance and coordination to align us for more holistic goals and visions.  

What we offer you  

You will get the chance to work with the latest technologies and highly skilled colleagues, at a world leading company with offices all around the world. We are growing fast and are looking forward to all the exciting challenges and opportunities that comes with it. So, this is where you come in.
We want you to enjoy working with us. Therefore, we offer great benefits, e.g. flexible working hours, breakfast every morning, corporate bonus, physical training grants, insurances, your very own Axis bicycle and so on.  

  

Ready to act?  

Are you ready to join us on our journey to innovate for a smarter, safer world - submit your application to us as soon as possible.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-02-24*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.

Därför söker vi fler kollegor som vill ansluta sig till oss, som är lika nyfikna som vi på att skapa innovativa IT-lösningar med fokus på digital tillgänglighet och inkludering. Vår ambition är att tänka om utvecklingsprocessen genom att göra tillgänglighet till en hörnsten i varje digitaliseringsresa - oavsett om vi pratar om användarvänlighet eller programvaruutveckling.

*Nyfiken på att gå med?*

Du kan påverka din karriärväg genom olika agila utvecklingsmetoder och arbeta nära kunden för att leverera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar värde och främjar deras framgång.

title: Senior Account Manager / Business Developer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Company Story**



Sigma Connectivity is a global tech house with all the resources needed to bring a product to market under one roof. We believe in investing in knowledge and education, making a positive impact on society and shaping a brighter future for all.



Through our core values, at Sigma Connectivity we create an environment that fosters growth, creativity, and collaboration. Our company culture promotes the freedom to explore new ideas and push the boundaries of what is possible.



Working with us means you will be working in an international environment with a diverse and inclusive atmosphere. We operate globally from 12 sites and have expert teams in North America, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, United Kingdom, UAE, Romania and Poland.



Together with world-leading organizations and Tech Companies, we continually push the boundaries of technology to deliver connected solutions.



**Introduction**



We are looking for a highly motivated, Senior Account Manager / Business Developer who wants to play a central part in our continued growth. In this role you will be a front man of Sigma Connectivity, actively promoting our brand and making sure our brand awareness.



You have an extensive experience from the tech Industry, probably in similar businesses like Internet of Things or Consumer Products. A strong passion for technology and a solid technical understanding is essential to discuss the clients’ opportunities and challenges in a professional way. You have probably worked in an environment where product development is central and understand what it takes to bring a product from an early idea or a vision to becoming a successful product on the market.



Organization wise you will report to the Vice President Sales of Sigma Connectivity AB. You will also work closely with the engineering organization. Based on our attitude “You never work alone” we will do whatever we can to support you in reaching our goals and having a lot of fun on the way!



**Responsibilities**



* Build your own network and find new leads in mainly Europe.
* Understand the market, develop a strong network, build a pipeline, and deliver sales.
* Manage existing accounts as well as building new accounts by presenting the company in personal meetings
* Engage with key stakeholders and develop strategic relationships, and partnerships.
* Drive the delivery towards customer by collaborating internally.
* Be a strong ambassador for Sigma Connectivity and our company values.


**Basic qualifications**

* Technical experience and preferably a University Degree within science
* Previously managed larger accounts and business development experience within Tech Industry
* Experience in negotiations and proven sales record
* Good project management skills, structured way of working, Team player, proactive in seeking information
* Willingness to visit customers, mainly in Europe
* Fluent in English


The candidate will be based in our HQ in Lund, Sweden.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Ola Lilja,  

+46 708517692  

Ola.Lilja@sigmaconnectivity.se

title: Supply Chain Developer - European Graduate Program
description:
**Location:** Luleå
  
  

**Country:** Sweden
  
  

**Application due date:** 2025-02-28 23:59:59 UTC
  
  

Do you want to kickstart your career and be part of shaping SSAB’s future? As a Supply Chain Developer you will manage interesting projects with real business impact. Join us in Luleå, Sweden and be part of building our supply chain capabilities for the future.
  
  

Becoming part of the SSAB family means joining a journey. A journey that we believe is essential for the sustainability of this planet. Steel has been one of the most important materials for developing our society and it will continue to be so. In the roofs over our heads, in the bridges connecting our cities and in the cars of tomorrow. At SSAB we are proud of our history and leadership in high-strength steel. But we are also aware that the production of steel is one of the largest emitters of greenhouse gases in the world. That has to change. That is why we have developed the world’s ﬁrst fossil free steel production and has committed to becoming largely fossil-free by around 2030. As part of SSAB you will be instrumental in realizing this goal and push for the green transformation of the whole steel industry.
  
  

About the program and position
  
  

The European Graduate Program is designed to attract and develop newly graduated talent to ensure SSAB’s future critical competencies. Over 14 months, you will participate in workshops and lectures that provide in-depth knowledge of SSAB’s operations, leadership practices, and a wide network of professional contacts.
  
  

The program includes visits to SSAB’s production sites in Finland and Sweden, as well as an individual trip to a business location of particular interest. Throughout the program, you will be paired with a senior mentor who offers personalized guidance and support. The program concludes with a final presentation to SSAB’s management team, where you will share your learnings and experiences.
  
  

SSAB is building a new mill in Luleå to replace the current one. This shift will have a big impact on our operations and in this role, you will be one of the first employees within supply chain in Luleå. You will get to learn about and contribute to our current operations as well as be part of shaping our future ways of working. You will be responsible for one or more ongoing projects within our supply chain organization, e.g. within order management, production planning, logistics and warehousing. This will require close collaboration across the SSAB organization, e.g. with the sales, production, and supply chain organizations, to identify and realize relevant development opportunities.
  
  

Main responsibilities
  
Be responsible for various projects within supply chain, both within our current and new operations
  
Collaborate with colleagues across the SSAB organization, e.g. from sales, production, and supply chain
  
About You
  
A university degree within supply chain, industrial engineering and management or other relevant field
  
Graduated within the past 24 months
  
Excellent English skills and solid knowledge of Swedish
  
To enjoy SSAB and be able to take advantage of this program to its fullest you also need to
  
Have good cultural awareness and willingness to work internationally
  
Have flexibility and ability to handle rapidly changing conditions
  
Have the ambition to drive development and improvement for both you and the company
  
Have ability to see the big picture
  
Be an excellent team player with a driven mindset
  
Have excellent communication and interaction skills
  
Our offer
  
  

At SSAB we strive for a diverse and inclusive environment. We use our values – driven, true and ahead – in making everyday decisions, keeping the customer at the heart of what we do. This makes us all team players, each with the drive to improve. When joining SSAB you will become part of an organization of passionate problem solvers working together on important challenges. We will support your growth by providing a safe and friendly workplace that contributes to work-life balance. If you set out to achieve it, at SSAB you will have the possibility of broadening your skills and grow within your field or beyond.
  
  

The program offers you
  
A 14-month kickstart to your development in an international company and environment
  
Permanent employment at SSAB after 6 months fixed-term contract with a market-relevant salary
  
Internal senior mentoring individually selected for you
  
Digital meetings with other participants to learn about different areas within SSAB
  
Planned physical visits to chosen SSAB sites, called Base Camp
  
Presentations, exchanging experiences and leadership tools
  
A customized study trip tailored to suit you and your development
  
A broad international network
  
  

Recruitment process
  
  

1. Apply
  
  

2. Digital assesments
  
  

3. Interview
  
  

4. Reference Check
  
  

5. Health Examination
  
  

6. Sign
  
  

Background check may be a part of the recruitment process. The health check also includes drug testing.
  
  

Got questions about this position?
  
  

Don’t hesitate to reach out to Sofie Nilsson, Supply Chain Manager Luleå, sofie.nilsson@ssab.com.
  
  

We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.
  
  

Word from your future manager
  
  

Hi! My name is Sofie Nilsson and I joined SSAB six years ago and I am working in our supply chain organization in Luleå. I’m very excited to welcome you to SSAB and our supply chain team!
  
By joining the European Graduate Program at SSAB you’ll get a unique opportunity to build a broad network within SSAB and learn about our business. You’ll work on interesting projects with competent, supportive, and driven colleagues, receiving the support and tools you need along the way. If you are interested in kickstarting your career within supply chain at SSAB, don’t hesitate to apply!
  
  

Sofie Nilsson
  
  

Join us at SSAB

title: Junior Product Developer for Women H&M
description:
**Job Description**  

As a Jr Product Developer you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating women’s collections to be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world. Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing collections, according to current and upcoming global trends. Your main responsibility is to support the Product Developer, creating the best products to our customers. You will be the important link between designers, pattern makers and planners throughout the entire process and make things happen around you. We therefore think that you are a true star when it comes to administrative tasks and sample handling, and love to work when no day is the same and the pace is fast. Here you will get the chance to be part of daily operational tasks and learn from experienced colleagues.

 **Qualifications**  

* Degree within textile and/or product development and/or similar
* Working as a Junior Buyer or Junior Product Developer
* Have passion for women’s customer and current fashion products
* Experience and competence within product development
* Driven and ambitious
* Strong salesmanship and see opportunities for growth and profitability
* Being structured, organized and take initiatives
* Being a team player with a flexible attitude
* See possibilities, improvements, and simple solutions

  

**Additional Information**  

We are recruiting to fill several full time positions with placement in Stockholm and start as soon as possible. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV **latest 17th of February**. Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying.)

**H&M WOMENS ASSORTMENT**  

At the Womenswear Assortment, you will be part of a fast pace environment and work with a current assortment for our customer – always with focus on quality, sustainability, and the best price. You will contribute to making progress towards our vision – A loved women´s fashion destination, leading the change to a sustainable fashion future.

**Benefits**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*


 We look forward to hearing from you!
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Junior data scientist och utvecklare - sommarjobb
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


Kretslopp och vatten i Göteborgs Stad söker tre engagerade sommarjobbare till vårt team för spännande projekt inom data science och applikationsutveckling. Om du brinner för kodning, analys och innovation är detta chansen för dig att göra skillnad i arbetet med vår stads vattensystem och att vara en del av stadens digitaliseringsresa!  

  

Under sommaren kommer du att arbeta i ett ert lilla team med andra talangfulla studenter. Tillsammans får ni utforska och utveckla applikationer för att analysera och visualisera data kopplad till våra vatten- och avloppssystem.
  

  

Arbetet kommer att innefatta delar av dessa moment:  

* Utveckling i Python: Skapa verktyg och applikationer som gör data mer tillgänglig och användbar.
* Dataanalys och visualisering: Hjälp oss att förstå vår VA-data genom smarta analyser och interaktiva dashboards.
* Innovation och problemlösning: Ta fram nya lösningar för dagens och framtidens utmaningar inom vatten och avlopp.

  

Du kommer att arbeta nära erfarna kollegor och få stöd i att utveckla dina färdigheter samtidigt som du bidrar till verkliga projekt som har betydelse för Göteborgs invånare.
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som:  

* Studerar inom ett relevant område, exempelvis data science, datateknik, IT eller ingenjörsutbildningar.
* Har erfarenhet av programmering, framför allt i Python.
* Är nyfiken, initiativrik och gillar att lösa problem.
* Har ett intresse för miljöfrågor och teknik.


Det är ett extra plus om du har erfarenhet av:  

* Machine learning och AI.
* Erfarenhet av containertillämpningar och teknik som Docker eller Kubernetes.

  

Den här tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad och förutsätter svenskt medborgarskap samt en godkänd säkerhetsprövning beståendes av bland annat registerkontroll, säkerhetsintervju samt alkohol- och drogtest.  

  

Sommaruppdraget sträcker sig till 2025-08-29 med chans till förlängning.
**Övrig information**
---------------------


Som anställd på Kretslopp och vatten kommer du att bli krigsplacerad inom ramen för Kretslopp och vattens roll i totalförsvaret.  

  

Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanbeder vi oss vänligen men bestämt att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om kompetensförmedling, annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
**Om Kretslopp och vatten**
---------------------------


Kretslopp och vatten är till för göteborgarna. Vi ansvarar för att några av Göteborgs viktigaste samhällstjänster fungerar, alla dygnets timmar, hela året runt. Genom arbetet med vatten, avlopp och avfall bidrar Kretslopp och vatten till att skapa ett kretsloppssamhälle som möjliggör för göteborgarna att leva hållbart. Vår vision är ”Vi gör det lätt att leva hållbart” och vårt jobb är viktigt på riktigt.  

Göteborg växer som aldrig förr. Vi arbetar med att säkra dricksvattenförsörjningen till staden genom att bygga och underhålla staden under marken. Vi påverkar och planerar för byggandet av ett Göteborg som ska klara morgondagens klimatutmaningar. Vi arbetar även med att se till att det avfall som göteborgarna genererar samlas in och behandlas på rätt sätt. Vi arbetar långsiktigt med göteborgarens medvetenhet och beteende kring kretslopp och användningen av dricksvatten.
  

Vi är en taxefinansierad förvaltning med stor fackkunskap med cirka 500 anställda. Inom organisationen har vi kompetens för att lösa vårt uppdrag – både när vi planerar och utför arbetet.
  

Delar du vår vision och vill veta mer om oss? Besök gärna www.goteborg.se/kretsloppochvatten eller följ oss på Facebook eller Linkedin.
