With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 950 000 consumers.

title: Android Developer
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
We are seeking experienced Android developers to contribute to the development of cutting-edge mobile applications within the electric vehicle (EV) charging and payment services sector.
 



 We offer a technically challenging role in an international environment, where your work will directly impact the transition from fossil fuels to electrification, supporting the global green energy movement.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As an Android Developer, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality Android applications that integrate with our advanced EV charging infrastructure and payment solutions. You will work at the intersection of software and the Internet of Things (IoT), collaborating closely with hardware systems such as EV chargers, payment terminals, and access control devices.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop, test, and maintain Android applications for EV charging and payment services.
* Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Ensure application performance, security, and scalability across different platforms and devices.
* Implement integrations with hardware components such as IoT-enabled EV chargers and payment terminals.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest Android development trends and best practices.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to process improvements.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.



  





**Required Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience in Android development using Kotlin and Java.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and third-party libraries.
* Familiarity with IoT concepts and hardware integration within mobile applications.
* Proficiency in version control tools such as Git.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Experience in the electric mobility or fintech industries.
* Knowledge of security protocols and data encryption methods.
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines for Android applications.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Work with an innovative team at the forefront of the green energy transition.
* Contribute to international projects with significant environmental impact.
* A dynamic workplace that encourages professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.

title: Java Developer – Core UI Technologies
description:
We are looking for a software developer to work on improving core user interface, communication and data layer frameworks. The majority of our development work is done in Java, with some use of C#.
 



  





**About COMSOL** 




 COMSOL develops cutting-edge mathematical modeling software that powers innovations in physics and engineering. Our flagship product, COMSOL Multiphysics®, is widely used across all fields of engineering, manufacturing, and scientific research to model multiphysics systems. Our customers leverage our software to understand, predict, and optimize product designs and processes. Founded in Sweden in 1986, COMSOL has expanded globally with 16 offices and a distributor network, employing more than 500 people worldwide.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 Based in our newly renovated office in central Stockholm, the user interface team works on the core functionality of the COMSOL product suite, focusing on the user interface, communication and data layer frameworks. The team also develops the Application Builder, COMSOL Server, COMSOL Compiler, and Model Manager functionality, which customers use to create, deploy, and manage simulation apps.
 



  





 Responsibilities include writing and reviewing code, contributing to project specifications and design, and testing new functionality.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 We are looking for both junior and senior developers with the following qualifications:
 



  




* M.Sc. or equivalent degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or physics.
* Excellent programming skills with proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language, for example Java, C#, or C++.



  





 Additional qualifications that would be highly valued:
 



  




* Work experience in relevant programming positions.
* Experience with larger software projects.
* Knowledge of software engineering and computer science.



  





 Knowledge of physics or simulation is not a requirement, but interest in these areas will help to better understand our product and market.
 



  





**Working at COMSOL** 




 At COMSOL, new team members quickly become essential contributors to ongoing development projects. As the company continues to expand, there are plenty of opportunities for employees to advance in their roles and become leading experts in their areas of focus. This journey will be accompanied by experienced colleagues and a collaborative working environment.In addition to an exciting career working on a sophisticated software product, we offer:
 



  




* A competitive salary
* Individual pension plans
* Sponsored gym membership
* Great work-life balance



  





 To ensure a smooth onboarding process, onsite presence is required. Once onboarded, hybrid work options are available.
 



  





**To Apply** 




 Does this sound interesting? Submit your application, including university grades, using the linked form. Kindly note that applications submitted through other channels will not be considered. We review applications continuously.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We’re a global team of over 400 people, working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Apache Kafka®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch® to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
   

  

 The Engineering team at Aiven lies at the core of our organization. This is a great opportunity to become an integral member of the team as a Senior Software Engineer. We look for engineers who can work around problems by finding new angles. Thinking sideways. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with world-class tech people solving the toughest problems, where almost every project you work on is more complex and technically challenging than the previous one. If you relish pushing your technical boundaries, come join us. Because if you can truly think sideways, you’ll never look back.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 So, how do we become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.
   

  

**Our values**
 We want individuals who can embody our values of ownership, courage, and openness.
   

  

 What does that mean in practice?
   

  

 We take ownership of the problems we solve. What we do is about improving life for our customers, enabling them to meet their goals. So we own our decisions and mistakes. Sometimes that takes courage. But we don’t falter – we take on challenges with confidence. And right at our heart is openness. We’re always open to new ideas – from wherever and whoever they come.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You will be part of the team that is focused on developing the cloud Apache Kafka service and improving its scalability and reliability. The team is also responsible for Apache Kafka Connect, Apache Kafka MirrorMaker2, several open-source Apache Kafka connectors, Karapace (Schema Registry and Kafka REST equivalent).
   

  

 While we use Python extensively, this is not a hard requirement, as we are looking for senior engineers who like our mission and are willing to embrace Python.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Writing high-quality, maintainable code and releasing quality features
* Performing peer reviews and participating in technical discussions both at the team level and among the product development engineering domain
* Contributing to technical planning and backlog management
* Helping investigate and resolve customer issues
* Mentor and empower other engineers around you


**What We're Looking For:**
 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
   

  

**Must-have**
* Excellent development skills, preferably in Python.
* The urge to write automated tests
* Experience using Linux in development
* Good understanding of security (software, networking)
* Fluency in English, verbal and written


**Nice-to-have**
* Hands-on experience developing and/or operating Apache Kafka and Apache MirrorMaker2
* Experience and/or interest in Infrastructure as Code
* Distributed systems knowledge
* Experience in cloud DBaaS production environments


**Our Offer**
 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
   

  

**We invest in you**
* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
* Get comprehensive wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.


**Make a difference at Aiven**
* Contribute to open source projects that you find relevant outside of work - and get paid for it. Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.


**What Else**
 As well as the above Global Benefits, we have regional benefits specific to your country of residence. We would be happy to discuss these further with you during the interview process.
   

  

**Amazing, What’s Next**
 If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!
   

  

**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams**
 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
   

  

 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven aligns with applicable local laws governing inclusivity in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
   

  

 At Aiven, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.

title: C++ Developer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As our C++ Developer at Xensam, you will design and build high-quality software solutions, leveraging modern C++ standards and best practices. You will work with our hardware and software inventory agent and have the opportunity to work on cross-platform development, optimize performance, and contribute to projects that drive impactful results.
 



  





 This role is expected to grow into a tech lead position, offering the opportunity to guide technical decisions, mentor team members, and play a central role in shaping impactful software solutions.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will develop, debug, test, and optimize software using modern C++ standards (C++11/14/17/20). You will also work with templates, STL, multi-threading, memory management, and object-oriented programming principles. Some of the other responsibilities that this role will include:
 


* Design and implement efficient solutions to complex technical challenges using robust data structures and algorithms.
* Contribute to cross-platform software development for Windows, Linux, and macOS.
* Develop Windows Services and work with technologies like WMI and WinAPI, if applicable.
* Collaborate using version control systems (e.g., Git) and build systems/tooling (e.g., CMake, MSBuild, Wix Toolset).
* Contributing to CI/CD pipelines, debugging, and profiling processes.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Preferably a degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* Strong knowledge of modern C++ standards (C++11/14/17/20) and programming concepts.
* Proficiency in data structures, algorithms, computational complexity, and efficient solution design.
* 3-5 years of experience in software development, debugging, testing, and optimization.
* Familiarity with cross-platform development for Windows, Linux, and macOS.
* Preferably experienced in Windows Services development, WMI, and WinAPI.
* Hands-on experience with Git, build systems/tooling (e.g., CMake, MSBuild), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of Agile methodologies and experience working within Agile teams.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a willingness to collaborate and support others.
* Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **3+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
 



 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
 



 Rollbeskrivning:
 



**Assignment** 




 Development, maintenance and troubleshooting of Scania’s offboard simulation solution and itsintegration to the autonomous vehicle software and the offboard platform. Support to final users occurs regularly.
 



  





**The assignment requires:** 




  Strong knowledge of Docker, AWS, GitLab pipelines
 



  Professional experience in working on Linux based platforms and Python
 



  Professional experience from large software projects
 



  Experience in maintenance of CI/CD
 



  Professional experience in working with AWS/ECS based solutions
 



  Team player with good networking and communication skills, curious learner.
 



  





**Education** 




 MSc (or higher) in Computer Science, Electrical engineer or similar.
 



  





**Language** 




 English, fluent
 



  





**Meriting** 




 Knowledge from autonomous vehicles and/or robotics is meritorious as well as experience or interest in simulation tools and agile way of working.
 



 Working knowledge of C++, Typescript/Javascript and web development is also a plus.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Arbetsplats och kultur
 



 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
 



 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Create high-quality and robust features, owning the development process from planning to final delivery.
* Work closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to plan and ensure high-quality results.
* Work with the engineering team to ensure best practices and code standards are followed.
* Leverage usage data and experimentation results to evaluate the performance and impact of released features, troubleshoot potential issues, and ideate new hypotheses for further iterations.
* Create and improve cross-app libraries to improve our productivity and workflow.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the Android ecosystem (developer tools, new Android APIs).
* Take an active role in roadmap planning, code reviews, problem solving, and testing sessions.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Extensive experience in Android development and Kotlin.
* Experience working on consumer apps with large user bases.
* A proven track record of delivering excellent and reliable code.
* A talent for technical problem solving and designing effective and maintainable abstractions.
* An ability to communicate concepts and solutions clearly and effectively to internal stakeholders.
* An ability to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
* A can-do attitude. Be a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence


**Application deadline:** 
 31-01-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate Senior Software Engineer.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 The Flower Portal is the cornerstone product of how our Partners track their investments in flexible energy assets and understand their impact on the energy system. As an early member of the team, your contributions will directly shape the product’s success and influence how Flower is perceived. Together, we’ll build a strong and collaborative team culture as we drive the green energy transition forward.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Dive into the world of green energy transition and gain a deep understanding of Flower’s offerings
* Collaborate closely with our Product Owner, and fellow Software Engineers in a small team to build great solutions
* Develop our product in typescript using tools like React and NestJS
* Build stable, scalable solutions and ensure quality by working with test frameworks
* Play a key role in shaping architecture, design decisions, and aligning development with user needs and business goals
* Bring clarity to complex data, helping Partners understand and engage with Flower’s vision and value proposition
* Drive new features connected to internationalization, diversification of our portfolio of assets and new realtime data streams
* Drive the development of new features, including internationalization, portfolio diversification, and integration of new data streams


**Who You Are**
 You are a humble and dedicated professional, ready to roll up your sleeves and dive into the work required to achieve our ambitious goals. Therefore, we believe that you possess the following traits:
   

  

* You’re a natural problem solver who loves tackling new challenges and apply 80/20 thinking to focus on the most impactful solutions
* Communication and teamwork are your strengths — you enjoy collaborating and bringing ideas to life
* You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy exploring unbeaten paths and embrace the ‘fail fast, learn fast’ approach
* You have 6+ years of experience in software engineering with a strong track record in a similar role
* You have a knack for building applications from scratch or scaling them up early on
* Backend development is your sweet spot, and you’re comfortable with frameworks like NestJS, Spring, or Django
* You you’re happy to see features through to the client and thrive working as a full-stack
* You have got deep experience working with cloud platforms and know how to leverage them effectively


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Head of Flower Portal, Engineers, VP of Asset Management, and our CEO.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Fullstack Developer - AI Team
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 100 highly skilled professionals.
 



  





 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
 



  





**The role:** 




 As a Fullstack Developer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, creating transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise as a developer, you and your team will lead the charge in building end-to-end solutions that help us deliver efficiency gains to our customers.
 



  





 You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.
 



  





 For this role, deep AI expertise is not a requirement, we already have AI expertise in the team. Instead, we are looking for experienced Fullstack Developers that can craft systems directly from customer requirements, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases, all the way to deployments and infrastructure.
 



 You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager and working closely with our Head of AI Product.
 



  





**Who You Are:** 




 You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.
 



 You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.
 



 You find AI developments interesting, and have experimented with them, and are eager to learn more.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
* Interested in learning more about the latest developments in generative AI, reading up on open-source projects and exploring AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
* Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of solutions to stakeholders.
* Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development
* Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
* You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
* Proficiency in Swedish



  





**What we offer** 



* Hybrid/remote work environment - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.



  





**Location** 




 We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.
 



  





**Excited?** 




 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

title: Senior Unity Developer | Candy Crush Solitaire, New games
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Our studio is creating the future of King games! We are championing innovation and exploring new territories for our next game - Candy Crush Solitaire.
   

  

 King New Games is looking for a passionate software engineer to help explore and forge exciting gameplay experiences to captivate our audiences in our latest solitaire experience within the Candy franchise.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You will be working directly in one of our prototype teams, collaborating hand in hand with our creative team, trying to find that next innovative spark.
   

  

 You are passionate about programming and have a sense of quality and polish. As a developer you have a generalist mindset and you are analytical and genuinely interested in the tech you work with, wanting to create a great tech foundation for games.
   

  

 We want you to have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and to be a strong team player, able to work in a fast paced, demanding, yet fun and professional environment.
   

  

****Skills to create thrills****
* Have a strong architectural knowledge with a generalist mindset and the ability to quickly adapt to new code bases
* Have a strong Unity/C# experience
* Experienced working in mobile gaming teams
* Work closely with your team, both creatives and developers.
* Help the team to grow to be a self organizing fast paced team.
* Be that extra eye on overseeing the technical quality of the project and be the driver for improvements and future tech innovations.
* Be part of the creative journey, actively contribute to the creative process, and then execute on it
* You are keen to grow and develop yourself and learn from others.
* You are very experienced in game development, being part of multiple game projects before.
* You are a team player who is used to working as a team and to discuss solutions and ideas as a group.


****Bonus skills****
* Experience creating and supporting tools used in game development.
* Professional experience of runtime performance optimisation, ideally on mobile titles.
* Experience from releasing mobile games
* Experience working on a casual or mid-core game using Unity/C#


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: PowerBi Developer to Group Risk Office
description:
**Job ID: 28050** 




 We are looking for a permanent PowerBI Developer that is skilled in MS SQL and DAX, to Group Risk office.
 



**About our team** 




 Meet the Group Risk Change Management team. Our role is to add value by general support to Group Risk and for this specific position for the entire Nordea group. As part of Group Risk Office and working with establishing the a common reporting solution you’ll play a key role in developing and implementing a common risk reporting solution for all group reporting teams across all three lines of defense.
 



 Our team is located in Gdynia, Helsinki and Stockholm. You will be part of a well-established and highly motivated team.
 



 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
 



**What you will be doing** 




**You will be a key person in the development of a common groupwide reporting solution supporting Non-financial risk management.** 



* Working with SQL and data warehouse (Hadoop, Hive etc.)
* Developing PowerBI dashboards and reports using DAX
* Data investigations, root causes analysis
* Building ETL and Data models



**Who you are** 




 This is the right role for you if have a professional drive, enthusiasm and commitment to achieve needed results, together with the team. We also believe that you are analytical and attentive to details, where you also have the ability to prioritize and manage uncertainty and change.
 



**Your background and skills include:** 



* Knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Power family (Power Apps, Power BI and Power Automate), Microsoft Excel (clean up data, relate and connect tables, etc.)
* Experience with MS SQL and DAX
* Experience with ETL of structured and non-structured data, data models and optimization of data.
* Experience with setting up workspace, Power BI app & access management
* Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, since all communication will be in English



**What we offer** 




 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 



**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 



**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
 



**Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work.** 
 We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 



**Next steps** 
  

  

 Submit your application no later than 03/02/2025. Please note that we will go through the applications on an ongoing basis, which means that the position might be filled before posting end date. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Brian Sørensen at brian.sorensen@nordea.com.
 



**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .
 



**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 



 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 



 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 



 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Analyst / Senior Analyst - Model developer
description:
**Job ID: 25328** 




 We are looking for a permanent Analyst/ Senior Analyst who thrives in an environment where you will have the opportunity to grow and build the next generation of strategic forecasting tools at Nordea in Python. The role can be based in Helsinki, Stockholm or Tallinn.
 



**About our team** 




 Meet the Financial Planning & Analysis team, a part of Group Financial Management, which amongst many things, is responsible for developing and maintaining the future forecasting models and infrastructure.
   

  

 We are a driven team that contribute towards the development of an efficient next generation of financial steering and forecasting solutions at Nordea. With us, you will be in good company to get the right conditions to deliver in your role and learn from your colleagues. We are creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
 



**What you will be doing** 




**As an Analyst / Senior Analyst in the Financial Planning & Analysis team, you will:** 



* Be exposed to the full end-to-end infrastructure in addition to the business logic pertaining to the forecasting model
* Develop the in-house Python based forecasting models – this includes the forecast of the balance sheet, profit and loss, capital plans and financed emissions forecasting (ESG) incorporating the key capital, funding and liquidity metrics
* Contribute throughout the entire development process (sourcing, development, testing and debugging)
* Steer the requirement setting and development of new features alongside the model users
* Securing that the end-to-end infrastructure is functional and in line with business and regulatory requirements for the future strategic forecasting tools
* Provide support to ongoing projects and changes



**Who you are** 




 This is the right role for you if you are a driven individual who enjoys working with Python and driving the data / model development in collaboration with the model users. We also believe that you work well with others and always act with the customer’s needs in mind. You have strong quantitative and analytical skills with an interest in financial forecasting analysis.
 



**Your background and skills include:** 



* As an Analyst 1 or 2 years and as a Senior Analyst 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience
* Master’s degree within engineering, mathematics, computer science or similar
* Experience of working with tools and technologies such as; Python and Pandas/ NumPy in a project setup
* Experience of working with ETL development and SQL
* Experience of working with version control systems such as GIT
* Experience of working with capital, liquidity or funding related items within financial services is not a requirement but beneficial
* Fluency in written and spoken English since all communication will be in English



 If you want to make your mark on something bigger and if this sounds like you, this is your sign to apply!
 



**Next steps** 
  

  

 Submit your application no later than 07/02/2025 , please note that we will go through the applications on a ongoing basis which means that the positions can be filled earlier, therefor send in your application as soon as possible.
 



 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Fabio Franco at fabio.franco@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 



 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 



**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 ​For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 



**What we offer** 




 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 



**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 



**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
 



**Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work.** 
 We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:** 



* Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
* Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
* Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
* Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
* Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
* Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
* Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Senior Coboldeveloper
description:
Multiply Tech & IT AB is looking for a Cobol developer to work with our client. You will work on new development, maintenance, and lifecycle management of their systems. You will be part of a team that follows agile principles, and besides coding, you will also work on analysis, development, and design. Their systems are on Mainframe.
 




  




* Experience: 5-8 years in the field, serves as a role model for junior consultants.
* Knowledge: High generalist competence or very high competence in the current field/role.
* Experience: Participated in major projects with high quality, typically achieved after 5 - 8 years in the field.
* Leadership: Takes main responsibility for leading a larger team.
* Independence: Very high.



 Interrested?
 



 You are very welcome to apply!

title: Cobol developer to Accounting Solutions | SEB, Solna
description:
At SEB, Team EKOT is dedicated to maintaining and managing the bank’s daily accounting operations. We work in an agile environment, ensuring the smooth running and continuous improvement of our financial systems.
   

  

 We are now recruiting a skilled COBOL Developer to join our dynamic team. As a member of Team EKOT, you will be responsible for both the maintenance and development of our core financial booking applications. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that meet the evolving needs of our business. Our system setup is mainly Mainframe applications where we are part of the consolidating and reporting flow to our end consumers in Finance. The team is a 13 headed multi-cultural group of highly skilled developers. We are in the initial phases of implementing the future roadmap where integration and gradual migrations will be both challenging and rewarding.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop, test, and maintain COBOL programs for our financial systems.
* Collaborate with team members to design and implement new features.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing applications.
* Participate in agile ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices.
* Interest in developing your own technical skills in a changing environment.


**The ideal candidate:**
* Proven experience as a COBOL Developer.
* Strong interest in learning banking and financial systems.
* Experience working in an agile environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team setting.
* Good communication skills in English.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-02-19. If you have questions about the position, please contact Team Manager Patrik Schwalbe at patrik.schwalbe @seb.se or 070-6393334, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Utvecklare inom Dynamics 365 och Power Platform
description:
**Som utvecklare hos oss får du chansen att driva utveckling och skapa innovativa lösningar inom Microsoft Power Platform som gör verklig skillnad för våra kunder. I denna roll är du en del av deras digitala resa – du skapar, anpassar och förbättrar lösningar som gör deras medlemssystem både smartare och mer effektiva. Med ditt tekniska kunnande och din förmåga att samarbeta kring utmaningar bidrar du till att automatisera arbetsflöden och omvandla data till insikter som stödjer kundernas framgång. Letar du efter en dynamisk roll där du får använda din tekniska kompetens för att skapa verkliga resultat? Varmt välkommen till Innofactor!**
**En vardag på Innofactor**
 Som utvecklare hos oss arbetar du med att utveckla, anpassa och optimera lösningar inom Microsoft Power Platform. Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att utveckla lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att digitalisera sina processer och förbättra sina medlemssystem. I denna roll är du med och bidrar till kunders effektivitet och utveckling genom att automatisera arbetsflöden och ta fram insikter som hjälper dem att fatta smartare beslut. Det viktigaste för rollen är att du har en god förståelse för Dynamics 365 CE och Power Platform.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Uppgifter**
* Implementera tekniska lösningar i samarbete med teamet.
* Vara delaktig i att säkerställa att teamet följer bra praxis och utvecklingsstandarder inom Dynamics 365 och Power Platform.
* Hjälpa till att introducera teamet till nya verktyg och teknologier relaterade till plattformen.
* Samarbeta med teamet för att lösa tekniska problem som uppstår under utvecklingsprocessen.
* Testa nya funktioner och teknologier inom Dynamics 365 och Power Platform för att bidra med förbättringar i projekt.
* Designa och utveckla lösningar med hjälp av Power Platform-applikationer, såsom Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI och CoPilot Studio.
* Bidra till utveckling av integrationer mellan Dynamics 365 och andra system (ERP, CRM, tredjepartsapplikationer) med verktyg som Azure Logic Apps och Power Automate.


**Kan du detta?**
 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med följande teknologier och verktyg:
   

  

* Dynamics 365 CE och Power Platform
* C#
* .Net
* JS
* VS Code
* git
* Azure
* DevOps.


**Den Vi Söker**
 Du beskriver dig själv som en person som är lyhörd och tydlig i din kommunikation, vilket hjälper dig att bygga förtroende och skapa engagemang. Du har ett affärsinriktat synsätt och är prestigelös, och du trivs med att samarbeta över gränser för att nå gemensamma mål. Med en balans mellan det praktiska och det långsiktiga drivs du av att skapa lösningar som håller över tid och levererar värde för kunder.
   

  

**Be the real you**
 Hos oss kan du vara dig själv! Här är ingen stöpt i samma form. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares olikheter och tror att utmanande uppgifter kräver nya och olika perspektiv. Alla har olika kvaliteter, och därför tror vi inte på att skriva ner en lista på egenskaper som vi söker. Det som däremot är viktigt är att du gillar att lösa komplexa problem, dela kunskap och arbeta självständigt. För att trivas i rollen bör du ha god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga både på svenska och engelska. På Innofactor innebär konsultmässighet att du hjälper våra kunder och är ett steg före, vilket gör att du kan föreslå nya lösningar eller lyfta förbättringsmöjligheter.

title: Sales Systems Manager / Salesforce Developer
description:
**Role Description:**
 As a Sales Systems Manager at HVD Group, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of all our Salesforce applications, and project managing the development our extended portfolio of Sales Systems. Your role will therefore cover a number of different areas, and systems, primarily around the development of our Salesforce ecosystem, including defining the prioritizations and roadmap for development across our systems landscape. The extended sales applications you would be responsible for include among others CPQ, e-signature, market intelligence, a subscription management system, a calendar booking application, various applications being integrated through Zapier, etc, as part of our continuously growing, and evolving systems landscape.
   

  

 Having been recently acquired by one of the worlds biggest Private Equity firms, HVD Group is going through a rapid growth journey both organically, and through acquisitions, with ambitious growth targets over the upcoming years, and is therefore looking to rapidly scale up its systems landscape accordingly. This role is therefore critical to ensuring we keep our systems landscape state of the art in order to facilitate the continued growth and changes that we are undergoing. We are therefore looking for someone comfortable with continuous change, and who is continuously looking for new ways to improve efficiency, and to bring added value to our organization.
   

  

 As part of your role, you would be providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices as we scale out our systems landscape. At times, this will include working with, and managing external consultants, and vendors in the integrations, and developments of HVD Group’s sales systems. You will be heavily engaged with various teams and stakeholders across the organization, where having a collaborative, and problem solving attitude, and an ability to manage many ongoing priorities will be essential, along with an ability to ensure continuous timely deliveries.
   

  

 If you enjoy a high paced environment, continuously working on new projects, and processes, and are looking to be part of an incredible growth journey, then we look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Collaboration: Partner with business stakeholders in Sales, GTM, Marketing and Customer Success to proactively identify, drive, and build improvements and scalable system solutions that solve business needs.
* Salesforce Development: Maintain, and manage a prioritized roadmap for the future developments, and integrations required in Salesforce. Conduct all business requirements gathering, documentation, development and testing; and where required leverage external Salesforce consultants or other solution experts. Ensure stakeholders are continuously updated on timelines and expectations for delivery.
* Budget management: Manage the budgets for systems licenses requirements, in alignment with the leadership teams, and finance as part of annual budgeting process. Provide business cases for any new, additional systems requirements.
* Vendor relationships: Maintain all IT vendor relationships, including managing vendor selections, benchmarking, and negotiations (in alignment with management and IT)
* Team leadership: Manage 1 direct report, consisting of a Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst, ensuring they are delivering quality work in a timely manner, and are continuously updating and communicating with stakeholders on timelines, prioritizations, status’s etc.
* Continuous Improvement: Work to improve existing Salesforce infrastructure and implement new features and functionality according to best practices. Use data and results to proactively seek out opportunities for improvement and enhancement of our current systems and processes.


**Skills and Qualifications required:**
* A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
* At least 8 years of Sales Systems Management experience. This must include at least 5 years of experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud.
* Proven experience as a Salesforce developer, including a strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, its architecture, and its limitations.
* Big plus would be if you have a Salesforce Architect background.
* Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce development tools.
* Knowledge of web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
* Salesforce developer certifications, such as Platform Developer I and II, are highly essential, with a Salesforce Architect certification highly preferred.
* License and budget management – ideally have a background managing budgets for licenses, and costs.


**Role location:**
 While we would prefer the role to be located at our Group HQ in Stockholm, we are open to hiring remotely, or based out of our regional offices, including among others, Oslo, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Berlin, Manchester, or Linköping.
   

  

**Travel:**
 Travel will be limited in this role, but will at times be required for project planning purposes, and execution of larger systems migrations or other systems implementations, in addition to team events.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is hiring a Cloud Engineer for our central technology organisation, Central Tech. Central Tech is our core technology team and we innovate in areas that push the boundaries for what open-world sandbox gaming means as well as enhance our players' online experience within our live-service games.
   

  

 In this role, you will contribute to developing and optimising our backend platform, Apex Connect, and its infrastructure in the cloud. Apex Connect is an integral part of the Apex Engine suite, a robust set of tools and services driving our live-service games. It plays a pivotal role in engaging millions of active players globally, providing essential services such as user authentication, data tracking, live event management, and advanced matchmaking.
   

  

 As a Cloud Engineer, you will be a part of our engineering team, focusing on setting up, operating, and refining our infrastructure in the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Designing, implementing and maintaining our backend platform infrastructure architecture
* Ensuring that our infrastructure is scalable, secure, performant and cost-efficient
* Leading the transition and expansion of Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Improving our CI/CD pipeline to ensure developer experience as well as service stability
* Supporting other members of the team, fostering an inclusive environment of growth and development within Central Tech
* Provide technical excellence and problem solving
* Be a champion for cost-efficiently running services in commercial cloud environments
* Be a champion for the scaling of backend infrastructure to meet high availability requirements


**Who You Are**
* Professional experience with cloud or hybrid infrastructure (preferably GCP)
* Able to set and explain measurable goals for service quality
* Experience with Redis, Memcache, or equivalent
* Experience working with package management and dependency
* Proficiency with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes
* Experience in establishing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
* Professional experience with one or more of the following programming languages Python, Go or C++
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Ansible, Chef, etc.)
* A solid understanding of software architecture
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal


**Bonus**
* Hands-on experience with Prometheus, Grafana and Google Cloud Monitoring
* Experience with Cloudflare DNS and Cloudflare DDoS protection products
* A passion and interest in gaming


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Golang Developer - Sweden-based
description:
**What We Do:** 




  





 Valsea Technologies is a global technical company specialising in Scala and JavaScript development.
 



  





 Driven by ongoing research and development, we’re dedicated to advancing our toolset to stay at the cutting edge, delivering state-of-the-art solutions for content, data, and performance management at scale.
 



  





 Our expertise is our people. Every aspect of our work is managed entirely in-house, from start to finish. Trust in our team is central to our corporate culture and success. Committed to fostering a global culture, our team proudly represents more than 20 different nationalities.
 



  





**Who you are:** 




  




* Proven experience in Golang and building production-grade systems.
* Hands-on experience with Docker, Timescale (PostgreSQL), Redis, and microservices architectures.
* Ability to work with Kubernetes and GitHub pipelines (nice to have).
* A hack mindset: Able to build, iterate, and adapt with minimal guidance while communicating effectively.
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a plus.



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Own the entire lifecycle of our payment processor app, from development through release and monitoring, taking it from beta to production-ready.
* Build and enhance bank integrations, platform stability, monitoring, back-office features, and security controls.
* Collaborate closely with the CTO and fellow engineers to deliver a robust, scalable product.



  





**What We Offer:** 




  




* Hybrid from Stockholm, Sweden.
* Health insurance.
* Opportunity to shape the future of a payment processor platform and work with a small, agile team where your input has a direct impact.



  





 If you're excited by the opportunity to solve real-world challenges and build a scalable payment system from the ground up, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Fullstack-utvecklare (C# .NET MVC)
description:
Som utvecklare hos kunden blir du en nyckelspelare i ett dynamiskt team där du får arbeta nära verksamhetens intressenter, arkitekter och andra utvecklare. Du kommer att vara involverad i hela utvecklingsprocessen - från kravanalys och design till implementation och förvaltning av kundens e-handelslösningar.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Gedigen kunskap om C# .NET MVC
* Erfarenhet av CMS-system, särskilt Optimizely CMS
* God kunskap inom frontend-utveckling med Bootstrap UI
* Stark förståelse för Azure-tjänster (App Services, Functions, SQL, Cosmos DB, Service Bus)
* Erfarenhet av e-handelsutveckling
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar med olika intressenter
* Ett genuint intresse för ny teknik och kontinuerligt lärande


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av tillverkningsindustrin och logistik
* Kunskap om digitala marknadsföringssystem
* Praktisk erfarenhet av PIM- och DAM-system
* Erfarenhet av DevOps och CI/CD
* Vana att arbeta i internationella team


**Som konsult hos Liminity får du tillgång till marknadens bästa villkor och förmåner, inklusive:** 
  

  

* Spännande uppdrag hos en framåtsträvande kund
* Omfattande utbildningsmöjligheter och certifieringar
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner
* Och mycket mycket mer, läs mer på https://handbok.liminity.se

title: Android-utvecklare
description:
**Plats** 
 : Stockholm, Sverige (Sveavägen 63)
 



**Typ** 
 : Heltid, tillsvidare (med initial prövoperiod)
 **Distansarbete** 
 : Hybridmodell – minst 3 dagar per vecka på kontoret
 



  





**Om Doktor.se** 




 På Doktor.se omdefinierar vi det svenska sjukvårdssystemet genom att göra det mer tillgängligt, smidigt och effektivt – utan att kompromissa med kvalitet eller säkerhet. Vår unika hybridmodell, som kombinerar fysiska vårdcentraler med moderna digitala lösningar, har gjort oss till den största digitala vårdgivaren i Sverige, med miljontals konsultationer varje år. Vi är också stolta över att vara en av de mest populära arbetsgivarna inom vården.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Android-utvecklare på Doktor.se spelar du en nyckelroll i att skapa teknik som förbättrar människors liv genom att förenkla deras tillgång till vård.
 



 Våra team tar stort ägarskap över helhetsupplevelsen och våra mål – från idé till lansering – kommer du att arbeta nära produktchefer, designers och andra utvecklare för att skapa innovativa lösningar som förbättrar vårdupplevelsen för miljontals användare.
 



  





**Vad du kommer jobba med** 



* Utveckla nya funktioner från idé till lansering i nära samarbete med ditt team.
* Bygga användarcentrerade gränssnitt i Material Design.
* Ansvara för att publicera i Google Play och kontinuerligt förbättra våra appar.
* Bidra till teamets utveckling genom att dela kunskap och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt.



  





**Din tekniska erfarenhet** 



* Du ska ha flera års års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling med gedigen förståelse av Kotlin och Android SDKer.
* Kunskap om ramverk som Hilt, Kotlin Coroutines och Retrofit.
* Erfarenhet av test-driven utveckling (TDD) och skriva enhets- och UI-tester.
* Kunskap om Android arkitektur och design patterns som MVI och MVVM.
* Kunna bygga gränssnitt med hjälp av Jetpack Compose och Material Design.
* Erfarenhet av modulär utveckling för att hantera komplexa kodbaser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med backend APIer som REST.



  





**Vem vi söker** 



* Fokus på användarna: Du har ett öga för detaljer och är van att balansera tekniska krav med användarens behov.
* Nyfikenhet och utveckling: Du är angelägen om att ständigt lära dig och utvecklas, både personligen och som en del av ett team, och du tycker om att hjälpa andra att göra detsamma.
* Samarbete: Du trivs i en agil, teamorienterad miljö och har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter.
* Du brinner för teknik som gör skillnad och vill använda teknik för att lösa riktiga problem och förenkla människors vardag.
* Språk: Vi kommunicerar huvudsakligen på engelska inom Tech-avdelningen, men förmågan att kommunicera på svenska med personer utanför Tech är en stor fördel.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* Anställning: Heltidsanställning tills vidare, med initial provanställning.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön: som speglar din expertis och erfarenhet.
* Generösa förmåner: 30 dagars betald semester per år, ITP1-pensionsplan, friskvårds- och utbildningsbidrag.
* Balans i arbetslivet: Flexibilitet och möjlighet till distansarbete för att stödja ditt personliga och professionella liv.
* Utmärkt arbetsmiljö: Ett stödjande, samarbetsinriktat team, ett vackert kontor på Sveavägen 63 i centrala Stockholm, och de verktyg du behöver för att lyckas. Vi träffas på kontoret minst 3 dagar per vecka.
* Personlig utveckling: Möjligheter att arbeta på meningsfulla projekt som påverkar miljontals människor. Med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling stödjer vi dig via coaching och möjlighet att vidareutbilda dig.



  





**Ansökningsprocess** 



* Startdatum: Så snart som möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
* Urval: Rekryteringsprocessen är pågående, och om din profil stämmer överens med våra behov, kommer vi att kontakta dig omgående.
* Bakgrundskontroll: Innan anställning kräver vi ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret och ID/passkontroll.
* Sekretess: På grund av GDPR accepterar vi inte e-postansökningar.
* Visum/flytt -sponsring: För denna roll krävs att kandidaten redan har arbetstillstånd och bor i Sverige.
* Byråer/Konsulter: Vi avböjer vänligen alla rekryteringsförfrågningar från byråer och konsulter samt jobbsajter.



  





**Var med och revolutionera vården!** 




 Med miljontals registrerade användare och stark tillväxt år efter år leder Doktor.se tillsammans med våra varumärken Doktor24 och Kollarna vägen inom digital och fysisk vård.
 



  





 Kom och hjälp oss förbättra vårdupplevelsen i Sverige!

title: Quantexa Developer
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Boost IT is a Portuguese technology consultancy company, we are integrated into one of the most entrepreneurial groups in Portugal, with investment in more than 30 companies.
 



 We want to be known for being the most dynamic, energetic, and reliable company to operate in the market, and, for that, we want to count on you.
 



 If you're passionate about technology and want to work on the most relevant technology projects, then this ad could be for you!
 



  





 We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer with Quantexa skillset.
 



 Able to work independently with defined problems on a highly complex level within certain areas of expertise.
 







**Requirements** 



* Hold a certified in Quantexa Academy
* At least 2 years of working experience in Quantexa projects
* Should be strong in Spark, Scala, Big data technologies
* Should have experience in Unix Shell scripting
* Nice to have experience in Hadoop Cloudera distribution
* Should have experience in setting the CICD pipelines
* Nice to have working experience in Oozie scheduler or any other job/workflow scheduler
* Good to have experience in ElasticSearch cluster
* Nice to have experience in Docker/Kubernetes platforms
* Nice to have experience in Oracle or any relational database



  





**Benefits** 



* 22 days of annual vacation leave (+ 3 additional days on us! - Birthday, Christmas Eve, and New Year's Eve)
* Hybrid work arrangement- 2 days a week in the office
* Career progression opportunities
* Training plan
* Health insurance
