title: VP Technincal Operations
description:
Viaplay is constantly delivering events to millions of viewers across multiple countries, with content ranging from Premier League matches to F1 races—all simultaneously and in multiple languages.
 



  





 As
 **VP of Technical Operations** 
 , you and your team will ensure a seamless, uninterrupted service. Your mission will be to build and optimize systems that proactively minimize incidents, optimize our streaming delivery, and ensure the team is prepared for any challenges that may arise. You’ll work closely with your TOC-team as well as to drive operational excellence and successful implementation of changes.
 



  





 You’ll contribute both strategically and hands-on, leveraging your expertise in technical operations, development, and DevOps. Our team operates 24/7, with a focus on meeting rigorous SLAs and delivering uninterrupted viewer experience.
 



  





 K
 **ey Responsibilities** 



* Lead, motivate, and mentor a team of 15, fostering a culture of quality and continuous improvement.
* Review current processes and solutions and identify areas for change to optimize performance, scalability, and incident response.
* Act as a bridge between the engineering teams and technical operations, ensuring effective communication, knowledge sharing, and alignment on priorities.
* Oversee SLA fulfillment and ensure a seamless, uninterrupted viewing experience for all customers, regardless of the service load.
* Foster a proactive approach to incident management, ensuring that systems are in place to prevent issues before they occur.



  





**Who We Are Looking For** 




 We’re seeking an empathetic and empowering leader with a proven track record of driving change in high-performance environments. You have extensive experience operating transaction-heavy, consumer-facing services, and understand the connection between development and operations.
 



  





**The ideal candidate has:** 



* A strong leadership presence with the ability to inspire, develop, and guide teams through change.
* Significant experience in B2C SaaS operations with a large user base, preferably in live service environments.
* Deep knowledge of DevOps, SRE, observability, and live operations best practices.
* Familiarity with Lean or Six Sigma methodologies (a plus).
* Hands-on experience in software development
* Experience with stakeholder management in a demanding environment.
* A customer-centric mindset and a pragmatic approach to process improvement.
* A collaborative spirit, eager to share knowledge and expertise across teams and departments.



  





**What Viaplay Offer You** 



* **Work-life balance** 
 : 30 days of paid vacation annually, a generous pension and insurance plan, and competitive parental leave benefits.
* **Well-being** 
 : Access to a wellness allowance and various initiatives designed to support your personal and professional health.
* **Continuous growth** 
 : A learning culture that empowers you to take control of your development, with ample opportunities to upskill.
* **Viaplay access** 
 : Unlimited access to our entertainment offerings, including TV series, movies, live sports events, and more—so you can experience the product firsthand.



  





 If you’re ready to lead a passionate, talented team in an exciting and fast-paced industry, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





***Viaplay is working with Safemind as its exclusive partner in managing this recruitment process.***

title: Full-stack Engineer - Connectors
description:
**About Neo4j:**

Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.



At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.



Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

  


**Our Vision:**

At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.



As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.


**The Team:**

  


In the Connectors team, we have six engineers. Our work enables Neo4j to connect with the data ecosystem, facilitating the movement of data from other systems into a graph for analysis and returning the results to various business systems. We build on a vast variety of technological stacks, from building products on top of Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, and Apache Beam to integrating Neo4j into Google Dataflow Templates and Microsoft Fabric. We also build backend components for our Data Importer product, including deployment of those into our Kubernetes-based infrastructure. At times, we also need to build frontends for our customers to interact with what we build.

  


**The Role:**



We are constantly building new or improving existing connectors for Neo4j, making our database accessible from a wider range of environments including widely used big data and data warehouse products in the cloud and on-premise, while also helping improve the core database’s data ingestion capabilities with new features.



As a full-stack software engineer, you’ll:


* Build front-ends for connectors or integrations that require user interaction
* Be part of designing and architecting connectors for the Neo4j database
* Build and maintain new and existing connectors for various technologies
* Design new streaming/data ingestion APIs to make Neo4j faster and easier to use for our customers
* When necessary work across teams to enhance our core database features

**What You'll bring to this role:**
-----------------------------------


* You have hands-on experience in frontend development, ideally with React and TypeScript
* You have 3+ years of experience developing production-level software systems, either in the cloud or on-premises
* You have hands-on experience with backend programming languages, such as Kotlin, Java, or Go

**Nice-to-have:**
-----------------


* Experience with graph databases such as Neo4j or other SQL/NoSQL databases
* Experience with distributed event streaming platforms, such as Apache Kafka or similar products


**We encourage you to apply even if you don’t have experience across all of these areas since the team has a mix of different skills.**

**Why Join Neo4j?**

Neo4j is, without question, the most popular graph database in the world. We have customers in every industry globally, and our products are a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to shape the future of data and analytics. Below are just a few exciting facts about Neo4j.


* Neo4j is one of the fastest-scaling technology companies in this industry. It recently surpassed $200M in annual recurring revenue (ARR), doubling its ARR over the past three years.
* Raised the biggest funding round in database history ($325M Series F). Backed by world-class investors like Eurazeo, GV (formerly Google Ventures), and Inovia Capital, Neo4j has raised over $600M in funding and is currently valued at over $2Bn. This puts Neo4j among the most well-funded database companies in history.
* 84% of the Fortune 100 and 58% of the Fortune 500 use Neo4j. Examples include Boston Scientific, BT Group, Caterpillar, Cisco, Comcast, Department for Education UK, eBay, NBC News, Novo Nordisk, Worldline, and others.
* Co-founder and CEO Emil Eifrem has built an amazing culture that prides itself on relationships, inclusiveness, innovation, and customer success.
* Countless industry awards. Massive enterprises and individual developers/data scientists love Neo4j. A strong sense of community and ecosystem is built around the platform.
* A recent Forrester Total Economic Impact™ Study cited Neo4j as delivering 417% ROI to customers.
* Neo4j was named as a Visionary in the 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud Database Management Systems among 19 other recognized global DBMS vendors. Neo4j was also ranked as a Strong Performer among 14 top vendors in The Forrester Wave™: Vector Databases, Q3 2024.


Research shows that members of underrepresented communities are less likely to apply for jobs when they don’t meet all the qualifications. **If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we’d encourage you to reconsider and give us the opportunity to review your application.** At Neo4j, we are committed to building awareness and helping to improve these issues.



One of our central objectives is to provide an inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience. We look forward to receiving your application.



**Neo4j Values:**

Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:



(we)-[:VALUE]->(relationships)  

(we)-[:FOCUS\_ON]->(userSuccess)  

(we)-[:THRIVE\_IN]->(:Culture {type: [‘Open’, ‘Inclusive’]})  

(we)-[:ASSUME]->(:Intent {direction:’Positive’})  

(we)-[:WELCOME]->(:Discussions {nature: ‘IntellectuallyHonest’})  

(we)-[:DELIVER\_ON]->(ourCommitments)



Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.

title: Software Engineering Leader | Customer Master Data
description:
**Job ID:** R0009443


**Date posted:** 27/01/2025


**Shape the Future of IKEA’s Digital Customer Experience**


At IKEA, togetherness and collaboration drive everything we do. Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. Join us in developing innovative, sustainable digital solutions that make a difference for millions around the world.

**The Role**


We’re seeking a hands-on Software Engineering Leader to take charge of the Customer Master Data (CMD) product in the Customer Engagement Domain. As a key player in shaping IKEA’s digital future, you’ll lead engineering efforts to deliver scalable, secure, and customer-centric solutions that enable seamless, personalized IKEA experiences globally.

**What You’ll Do**

* Own engineering for the CMD product, aligning across teams and domains.
* Collaborate with the Product Owner to co-create and execute a forward-looking technical roadmap.
* Champion best practices in code quality, scalability, and security while ensuring simplicity and sustainability.
* Mentor and inspire engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, learning, and collaboration.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex challenges to ensure smooth product delivery and performance.
* Represent IKEA’s technical leadership and commitment to meaningful customer solutions internally and externally.

**What You Bring**

* 10+ years in software development, with expertise in solution architecture and agile practices.
* 3+ years of cloud experience (preferably Azure).
* Proficiency in technologies like Node.js, .NET, Python, C#, Java, Databricks, SPARQL, and APIs.
* Strong leadership and communication skills to inspire teams and engage diverse stakeholders.
* Passion for innovation and building digital products that put the customer first.

**Why Join IKEA?**

* Collaborate with a global team driving meaningful digital transformation aligned with IKEA’s vision and values.
* Embrace flexibility with a blend of in-office and remote work.
* Create scalable products that directly impact millions of customers while promoting affordability and sustainability.
* Be part of a company where togetherness and caring for people are at the heart of everything we do.


At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers’ dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.  

  

If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.

 **More Information**  

This is a full-time position (40 hours per week) based in Malmö, Sweden. You’ll report to the Product Manager for the Customer Engagement Domain.

*For questions about the role, please contact Polo Welschen (**Polo.Welschen1@inter.IKEA.com**). For questions about the recruitment process, please contact Sarah Arshad (**Sarah.Arshad@inter.IKEA.com**).*

**Closing Date**


Send your CV and motivation letter in English by 10 February 2025. Show us why you’re the perfect fit to lead engineering at IKEA. Together, let’s create a better everyday life for the many people!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Domain Engineer - Payments
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**As a Domain Architect (DA), you will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and governing the architecture of our Payments domain with a main focus on evolving our Payments gateway, within our organization. As a DA, you will ensure that our systems and solutions are scalable and reliable and align with the overall enterprise architecture, business goals, and industry best practices. You will belong to the architect team within Payments and report to the Head of Engineering. **YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:*** Develop and maintain the architecture for the Payments domain.
* Define architecture principles, models, and guidelines.
* Ensure the architecture is scalable, resilient, and aligned with business and overall IT strategies.
* Work closely with business stakeholders such as PMs (Product Managers) and POs (Product Owners) to understand their needs and translate them into architectural solutions.
* Define and enforce architectural standards, best practices, and governance processes.
* Responsible for maintaining and further developing the technical roadmap for the payments domain.
* Drive continuous improvement in the Payment architecture, ensuring it evolves in response to changing business needs and technological advancements as well as legal requirements.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of the architecture, including diagrams, models, and decision logs.

 **OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**  

  

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* 3+ years of experience in architecture roles, specializing in leading the design of robust, scalable, and efficient components and features for complex systems.
* Deep understanding of technologies and tools related to cloud platforms (GCP).
* Ability to align domain-specific solutions with broader business and IT strategies.
* Strong ability to articulate complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle domain-specific challenges.
* Ability to lead and mentor teams, driving collaboration across multiple departments and influencing architectural decisions.

  

NICE TO HAVES

* Understanding and experience of payment specifics such as card processing, open banking and APM (Alternative Payment Methods) integrations.
* Development experience, using Java/Kotlin, Spring Boot, MySQL and Kafka.

 **WHO WE ARE**  

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.  

  

**BENEFITS*** Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts

 **JOIN US!**


In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
description:
* Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
* Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
* Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
* Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
* Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
* Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
* Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
* Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
* Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
* Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
* Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
* Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
* Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.

Key Skills and Knowledge Areas

* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.

Tools and Technologies

* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code

title: Senior Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst
description:
Are you a skilled Salesforce Administrator and Business Analyst with a passion for optimizing systems and driving data-driven decision-making? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to be a key player in a rapidly growing organization? Join us at HVD Group, where we’re embarking on an exciting journey of expansion, and contribute to building cutting-edge systems that will power our growth.
  
  

The Senior Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst is responsible for managing and optimizing the Salesforce platform to support smooth business operations and improve data-driven decision-making across Sales, GTM, Marketing, and Customer Success. This role involves working closely with these teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and implementing solutions that enhance business performance. A successful candidate will have a strong background in Salesforce and best practices, strong analytical skills, a deep understanding of business operations, and the ability to communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels. This position reports to the Sales Systems Manager, covering our group of companies.
  
  

Having been recently acquired by one of the world’s biggest Private Equity firms, HVD Group is going through a rapid growth journey, with ambitious growth targets over the upcoming years, and is therefore looking to rapidly scale up its systems landscape accordingly. This role is critical to ensuring we keep our Salesforce, and PowerBI environments state of the art in order to continuously improve our operational efficiency, and ability to quickly identify, and leverage key insights. We are therefore looking for someone who is continuously looking for new ways to improve efficiency, and to bring added value to our organization.
  
  

If you enjoy a high-paced environment, continuously working on new projects and processes, and are looking to be part of an incredible growth journey, then we look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Collaboration:** Partner with business stakeholders in Sales, GTM, Marketing, and Customer Success to proactively identify, drive, and build improvements and scalable system solutions that solve business needs.
  
**Salesforce Administration:** Manage user setup, profiles, roles, permissions, customization of objects, fields, record types, page layouts, Flows, workflows, process builder, and other Salesforce configurations.
  
**System Integration:** Work closely with stakeholders to implement and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other business systems, ensuring data accuracy and consistency. This includes a vast suite of applications including CPQ, e-signature, market intelligence, subscription management, calendar booking applications, Zapier connected systems, back-end systems, etc.
  
**Data Management and Quality:** Perform data imports, exports, data cleansing, and data quality assessments to maintain data integrity within Salesforce. Manage duplicate Leads, Contacts, and Accounts, and perform mass uploads and updates of data as required. Remove unnecessary fields and data, ensuring screens, fields, and workflows have accurate names and reflect current workflows.
  
**Continuous Improvement:** Work to improve existing Salesforce infrastructure and implement new features and functionality according to best practices. Use data and results to proactively seek out opportunities for improvement and enhancement of our current systems and processes.
  
**Reporting and Analytics:** Partner with business stakeholders to develop and maintain reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights and support decision-making processes and forecasting. Create audited, official source-of-truth reporting for business performance, and remove outdated reports, both within Salesforce and PowerBI.
  
**Salesforce and PowerBI Training:** Build a Salesforce and PowerBI training academy, including training videos and self-service training content to support new and existing users with the navigation and best practice usage of systems. Lead training courses for all new hires, in addition to refresher courses, while ensuring all users are trained on all new features as they get added and developed.
  
**Other System Administration:** Perform basic administration responsibilities for key sales systems (Salesforce, its connected applications, and PowerBI) like user management, troubleshooting, and configuration as aligned with operational needs.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

4+ years experience as a Salesforce Administrator & Business Analyst
  
Salesforce Administrator certification (ADM 201) is preferred; additional certifications such as Advanced Administrator (ADM 301) are a plus.
  
Microsoft PowerBI experience, including experience supporting leadership teams with reporting, and dashboards.
  
Strong knowledge and experience around Salesforce Sales Cloud features
  
Experience with Salesforce integrations, APIs, and other associated tech stack software
  
Expertise in translating business requirements into technical/software requirements, process modeling, and data mapping
  
Hands-on writing Salesforce Validation, Workflow, and Flows.
  
Excellent analytical and technical aptitude and ability to solve problems
  
Excellent time management and organization skills with an ability to work on multiple tasks in parallel
  
Detail-oriented and self-starter with strong written and interpersonal skills
  
Comfort in a fast-paced, quickly evolving environment
  
  

**We Offer:**  

The opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-growing environment with global impact.
  
An engaged and innovative team that values collaboration and creative thinking.
  
Professional development and training opportunities
  
  

If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and want to be part of a dynamic and fast-growing company, we’d love to hear from you. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to shape the future of our systems and make a real impact. Apply now and become a key player in our journey to success!
  
  

About the company
  
  

HVD Group is developing rapidly and is working hard to conquer the European market on software for craftsmen. We are a team of over 500 people in multiple locations working locally and globally to achieve our mission. Our teams are changing the industry and improving the everyday life of thousands of workers and businesses - from the family-owned to enterprise customers.
  
  

Through innovative technology and years of expertise in the craftmanship industry, we have successfully partner with over 10,000 customer and gained trust of 100,000 users in different segments of the industry. Our vision is to become the European leader in providing business systems for the craftsmen industry. To accomplish this ambitious goal, we need to continue building our teams with strong talent, like yourself.
  
  

Jessica Ögren | Contact Person

title: Data Analyst to the division Business & Retail Banking \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you driven by the potential of leveraging data as a strategic asset within an organization? Are you eager to uncover valuable insights that provide a broad understanding of SEB and our customer base? Do you have a keen interest in doing in-depth data analysis with new tools in cloud-environment? If so, this opportunity could be the perfect fit for you!

The Business & Retail Banking (BRB) division is now strengthening the Data, Analytics & CIO organization further to accelerate the journey towards a more data driven and customer-centric bank. We are a team with highly engaged and skillful data and analytics professionals, and we are now looking for a Data Analyst, who will report to me, Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics.

**About the job**
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving initiatives within the area of data and analytics, like value driven analytical use cases, usage of new technical capabilities, and more. SEB is committed to accelerating its data and analytics journey, underscoring the imperative to mobilize and bolster expertise and execution capabilities.

Your primary focus will be around deepening our understanding of customer behavior, needs, and preferences. This entails identifying, analyzing, exploring, and interpreting trends and patterns within complex datasets through detailed data-driven analyses. Also, you will actively support internal stakeholders by proactively uncovering potential opportunities across various areas.

Further, you will be part of a center of analytical excellence dedicated to identifying business opportunities, exploring customer segments, product categories, and distribution channels, fostering a more data-centric and customer-focused way of working.

You'll also be important in building the new cloud-based data- and analytics platform, shaping our future environment aligning with SEB: s long-term strategic direction. That includes futureproofing of tools and data, but also a new way of working and ensuring competence needed.

The position is in Arenastaden, Solna.
**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
We are seeking individuals who hold an enthusiasm for data, business acumen, and adaptability in dynamic environments. We encourage proactive engagement, both presently and with a forward-thinking mindset.

Ideal candidates will hold an academic degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Economics, or a related discipline, coupled with a couple of years of hands-on experience in quantitative analytics. Proficiency in cloud-based environments, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with a focus on data and analysis, is highly desirable. Additionally, familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL for data analysis is advantageous. The role also requires prior experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau. Experience from Financial services is merited.

The ability to effectively communicate and present findings to stakeholders is of great importance. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish. Strong interpersonal skills are key for collaborating within our cross-functional teams and engaging with stakeholders. We value individuals who demonstrate dedication, proficiency, and a collaborative spirit in their work.

Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
**Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.**
**Welcome with your application**
Attach your CV and a short personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the data driven journey at BRB. Since we select candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-02-16. If you have questions about the position, please contact Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics, phone +46 70-76 76 142 or e-mail magnus.klint@seb.se
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Territory Manager
description:
Veeam®, the #1 global market leader in data protection and ransomware recovery, is on a mission to empower every organization to not just bounce back from a data outage or loss but bounce forward.



With Veeam, organizations achieve radical resilience through data security, data recovery, and data freedom for their hybrid cloud.



The Veeam Data Platform delivers a single solution for cloud, virtual, physical, SaaS, and Kubernetes environments that gives IT and security leaders peace of mind that their apps  

and data are protected and always available.



Headquartered in Seattle with offices in more than 30 countries, Veeam protects over 450,000 customers worldwide, including 74% of the Global 2000, who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running.

  

The Territory Manager will be responsible for developing/closing business indirectly with a number of customers in their assigned market territory through working with the partner sales community. The primary focus is aimed at closing sales opportunities and is achieved by collaborating with partners to identify, develop, accelerate, up-sell and close transactions.


#### **Your tasks will include:**


* Develop and close business with accounts.
* Leverage partners to close sales with their end customers
* Cold calls to develop sales activities with a large number of new mid-market and high-segment end users
* Up-sell and cross-sell to the existing customer base
* Forecasts and account/opportunity details in SalesForce
* Propose, coordinate and participate to marketing activities in the territory

#### **What we expect from you**


* Fluent in English and Swedish (Finish or Danish considered a plus)
* Direct, new business sales experience within a SaaS environment
* Have experience of selling through channel and direct
* Track record of accomplishment selling to the IT infrastructure specialists
* Be a self-starter with the ability to learn quickly
* Be a high-energy salesperson
* Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where roles and responsibilities change quickly
* Be comfortable travelling for at least 60% of the time.
* Current full driving license

#### **We offer:**


* Competitive salary depending on skills and expertise
* Flexible Working
* Modern energetic multinational working environment
* Interesting people, an excellent team of professionals
* Opportunities for professional growth and career


Please note: If the applicant is permanently located outside of Sweden, Veeam reserves the right to decline the application for the position. Remote work is only possible for employees located in Sweden.  

#LI-JK1



Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.



The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.



By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

title: Data Scientist
company: Who Collaborating Centre For Int Drug Monitoring
description:
Do you want to use your data science expertise to help make medicines safer? Do you thrive in multidisciplinary teams and enjoy solving concrete problems? Would you like to contribute to an efficient development culture for transforming research discovery into valuable products? Then this position could be the right fit for you!
  
  

Uppsala Monitoring Centre (UMC) is a dynamic non-profit foundation with an internationally recognised role within the field of pharmacovigilance, whose ambition is to improve the safety of medicinal products throughout the world. We manage and analyse VigiBase, the WHO global database with more than 35 million reports of suspected side effects reported by patients and healthcare professionals in more than 150 countries. This puts UMC in a unique position to detect safety concerns associated with medicines.
  
  

Within the Research department, our passionate and savvy data scientists are committed to creating and advancing methods for data-driven discovery of previously unknown safety issues with medicines. They are also focused on developing computational methods to support and enhance human decision-making in pharmacovigilance.
  
  

We are looking for a skilled and creative data scientist to support our work and contribute to the team’s development. The data scientist will have a unique opportunity to help research outputs bring value to internal and external stakeholders, reflecting UMC’s core values of excellence, equity, benevolence, and solidarity in a fun and dynamic multidisciplinary department.
  
  

What you will do
  
  

* Work in agile multidisciplinary teams composed of data scientists, research pharmacists, and medical doctors.
* Create, implement, and evaluate novel methods to advance the science of pharmacovigilance with statistical modelling and machine learning.
* Communicate results with internal and external stakeholders, adapting to the diversity of their backgrounds, as well as disseminate research via scientific publications and participation in research conferences.
* Participate in competence development by staying up to date with advances in machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP) research and apply it to our settings.
* Acquire a deep understanding of our unique database of side effects to support research pharmacists and medical doctors in their decision-making or research questions.


About you
  
  

* You have an MSc or PhD degree in computer science, engineering, or other quantitative discipline.
* At least three years of professional data science experience.
* Advanced coursework in machine learning and programming, and experience in cloud computing are a plus.
* Interest in Neural Networks and Large Language Models is a plus.
* Experience with data querying languages and working with databases.
* Proficient in programming with Python; knowledge of R is a plus.
* Experience in mentoring junior data scientists and overseeing data-centred projects.
* Strong interpersonal skills and are comfortable working with multiple stakeholders with diverse backgrounds and nationalities.
* Innovative, independent, driven, and can quickly devise fit-for-purpose deployment solutions.


Located in the heart of Uppsala, three minutes away from the central station, we are currently around 180 employees and consultants and have generous employee-benefit policies. In addition, UMC allows hybrid working, with the opportunity to work remotely up to 2 days a week. For more information about our activities and products, visit www.who-umc.org.
  
  

Uppsala Monitoring Centre (UMC) is a non-profit foundation established in 1978 through an agreement between the World Health Organization (WHO) and the government of Sweden as a WHO Collaborating Centre for International Drug Monitoring.
  
  

UMC is custodian of the WHO global database of adverse event reports for medicines and vaccines and strengthens global safety surveillance through science and innovation, signal analysis and pharmacovigilance tool development, standardisation with the WHODrug dictionary, and education and communication.
  
  

UMC’s working language is English. We normally apply a probationary period to new appointments.
  
  

If you have any questions regarding this position please contact the responsible manager. You will find the contact details at the end of this page.
  
  

UMC follows the collective agreements between the Swedish Agency for Government Employers and Saco-S and ST. Union representatives are Malin Zaar (Saco-S) and Jessica Avasol (ST), +46 (0)18-65 60 60.

title: Senior MLOps engineer
company: Who Collaborating Centre For Int Drug Monitoring
description:
Would you like to use your data engineering expertise to enhance the safer use of medicines and vaccines? Do you excel in diverse, multicultural teams and find satisfaction in tackling problems that deliver tangible benefits? Are you eager to drive a dynamic development culture that transforms research discoveries into impactful products? Then this position is right for you!
  
  

Since 1978, Uppsala Monitoring Centre (UMC) has been dedicated to developing, supporting, and expanding the field of pharmacovigilance science and practice.
  
  

As a World Health Organization (WHO) Collaborating Centre, we support work around the world to examine the potential adverse effects of medicines and vaccines and contribute to safer, more informed care of patients.
  
  

We are a diverse, international group of pharmacists, physicians, data scientists, system developers, communicators, and many other professionals motivated by a deep belief that the work we do matters.
  
  

We are seeking a skilled senior MLOps engineer to join our Research team. This role is crucial in helping our data scientists deploy models on Azure, manage CI/CD processes, ensure proper experiment tracking, and deploy API backends for both internal use and future external integration. The ideal candidate will also contribute to automating deployment pipelines and enhance team delivery and code quality by implementing best practices in software development.
  
  

You will report to the Head of Data Science within the Research department, working alongside a team of data scientists to transform proof-of-concept research into production. You will be in a unique position to leverage research outputs, adding value for both internal and external stakeholders within a fun and dynamic multidisciplinary department.
  
  

What you will do
  
  

* Model deployment and management- Collaborate with data scientists to deploy machine learning models on cloud platforms.- Ensure deployed models are continuously monitored and retrained as necessary.- Design scalable systems to handle increased load and data size.
* CI/CD and automation- Design and manage CI/CD pipelines for continuous deployment and integration of models.- Automate deployment pipelines to streamline model deployment processes.
* Experiment tracking and reproducibility- Implement proper experiment tracking during model development to ensure reproducibility.
* API development and management- Deploy API backends in the cloud, setting up API keys and access controls for internal and potentially external use.- Implement security best practices for model deployment and API management.
* Collaboration and training- Teach the team best practices in software development, including version control, code reviews, and testing.- Work with different teams to integrate deployed models with various applications.- Create comprehensive documentation for deployed systems and provide training to team members.- Work in close collaboration with our Azure infrastructure team to ensure harmonisation.
* Optimisation and cost management- Optimise cloud resources to manage and reduce costs effectively.
* Innovation and improvement: - Propose and implement initiatives for automation and harmonisation to improve team efficiency.- Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in machine-learning engineering and MLOps.


Who you are
  
  

* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field.
* Proven experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure).
* Strong knowledge of Python and machine learning frameworks, knowledge of R is a plus.
* At least 5 years of experience in MLOps and designing and managing CI/CD pipelines.
* Proficiency in Git.
* Knowledge of one IaC language is a plus.
* Understanding of API development and management, including security best practices.
* Experience with experiment tracking tools (such as MLflow, Weights & Biases).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
* Good understanding of cloud security best practices and compliance standards.
* Rigour in documentation and testing.
* Strong interpersonal skills and comfortable working with multiple stakeholders from different backgrounds and nationalities.
* Innovative, independent, driven, and can quickly devise fit-for-purpose deployment solutions.
* Generous and enjoy helping others to solve problems.
* Certification in cloud platforms or machine learning is a plus.
* Experience of deploying open LLMs on VPCs is a big plus.


Located in the heart of Uppsala, three minutes away from the central station, we are currently around 180 employees and consultants and have generous employee-benefit policies. In addition, UMC allows hybrid working, with the opportunity to work remotely up to 2 days a week. For more information about our activities and products, visit www.who-umc.org.
  
  

Uppsala Monitoring Centre (UMC) is a non-profit foundation established in 1978 through an agreement between the World Health Organization (WHO) and the government of Sweden as a WHO Collaborating Centre for International Drug Monitoring.
  
  

UMC is custodian of the WHO global database of adverse event reports for medicines and vaccines and strengthens global safety surveillance through science and innovation, signal analysis and pharmacovigilance tool development, standardisation with the WHODrug dictionary, and education and communication.
  
  

UMC’s working language is English. We normally apply a probationary period to new appointments.
  
  

If you have any questions regarding this position please contact the responsible manager. You will find the contact details at the end of this page.
  
  

UMC follows the collective agreements between the Swedish Agency for Government Employers and Saco-S and ST. Union representatives are Malin Zaar (Saco-S) and Jessica Avasol (ST), +46 (0)18-65 60 60.

title: Technical Risk Analyst
description:
Are you ready to take the next step in your career and play a central role in developing our risk management work? We need to strengthen our IT security team and are now looking for a Technical Risk Analyst who works with development tools and IT security.
  
  

A little more about the role
  
  

You will be an essential part of shaping and driving the work to ensure that our IT processes meet the requirements of both Swedish and Danish authorities, our owners, and new regulations such as NIS2. The role has a broad scope, from conducting annual risk workshops for all IT flows and value streams, providing advice and support, and handling ad-hoc risk analyses in case of incidents. The work also includes identifying risks, proposing mitigations, and ensuring that these are implemented in a tangible and user-friendly way. As part of our team, you will also be involved in implementing and improving our work with ISO 27001, which forms the basis for our risk management.
  
  

In this role, you will work closely with several stakeholders, such as the IT and Network Department, regulatory authorities in Sweden and Denmark, Group Reporting and Control and our owners. To effectively manage risks, the role requires working at the intersection of both the business and technology.
  
  

The role is new to the team, and you will have a great opportunity to shape and point out the direction on increasing risk awareness within the organization.
  
  

You can look forward to
  
  

shaping and project leading a critical function for Tre
  
working at a company that delivers critical infrastructure where your contribution directly contributes to societal benefit and ensures that important functions run smoothly
  
working at one of Sweden's best workplaces, according to Great Place To Work
  
belonging to an employer that wants to contribute to women wanting to choose and stay in the technology industry, we are proud partners of Women in Tech and Tjejer Kodar
  
  

A little more about you
  
  

To succeed and thrive in the role, we see you have a few years of experience working with risk management in a previous role, preferably in a similar environment. You are analytical and have an eye for detail, allowing you to identify risks and find practical and feasible solutions quickly. You have a university degree in technology (or equivalent) and strong communication skills that allow you to adapt to different target groups—from specialists to management groups. Since the role involves collaboration with colleagues in Sweden and Denmark, you need to be fluent in spoken and written English; it is advantageous if you speak Swedish. It is a plus if you also have experience in the telecom industry or have worked with standards such as ISO 27001 or regulations like NIS2 or DORA before. Your drive and commitment have made you successful with your employers, but now you feel that it is the right time for a change and wish to take a further step in your development.
  
  

Work with great people
  
Julia Maxén
  
Team Manager
  
"I want my team to have the best conditions to excel in their roles. By empowering each member to perform at their best, we not only grow stronger as a team but also drive Tre forward to new heights"
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital Project Lead
  
"The absolute best thing about being a project manager at Tre is that I get to work broadly with colleagues from all parts of the organization and learn new things every day. I have the freedom to be myself – and be appreciated for it!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Developer
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Welcome with your application!
  
  

We are accepting applications via this job ad, and interviews are ongoing. A personal letter is not required, but we would like you to answer the questions we ask in connection with your application. We use tests to ensure objective assessments in the selection of candidates. The position may be filled before the application deadline. Security interview and background checks are carried out on the final candidate.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Health care allowance, parental pay, pension & insurance according to collective agreements
  
  

Dog zone & gym in the 3house
  
  

Great discounts on bicycles, public transport, and electric cars
  
  

Flexible holidays and five extra days off per year
  
  

Subsidized lunch
  
  

Generous bonus models or commissions
  
  

We are driven by constantly trying to improve things in new and different ways. Of course, we are at the forefront of developing future networks.
  
  

We see ourselves as a crucial part of Sweden's social structure because we know that reliable connectivity is a necessary foundation stone in today's digital world. That's why we see it as our job to keep our mobile network up and running year-round, 24/7, to ensure you can always count on being connected when you need it most.
  
  

Tre was born as a challenger and is an organization in constant motion. We strive to be at the forefront of everything we do. We are convinced that the people at Tre are decisive for our development.
  
  

No matter how you start your journey at Tre, there are endless opportunities to grow and develop with us.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - In a constantly changing world, we stay curious and open minded. Born with a challenger mindset, we love pushing boundaries.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - As true champions, we always do our best. We take ownership, set clear goals and stay focused. Together we´re on a winning streak.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - Free to be ourselves, we treat each other with respect. Together we make a friendly bunch, born, and one tough force.
  
  

2003
  
Tre was the first in Sweden to offer video calls and mobile video streaming. At this time, seeing the person you are calling in the eyes is a completely new experience.
  
  

2006
  
Tre launches mobile broadband as the third operator in the world. Over the next five years, Tre will win awards for Sweden’s fastest mobile broadband.
  
  

2013
  
Hallon, Tre’s sister company, was created with the idea of being a simple mobile operator, free from any unnecessary fuss.
  
  

2019
  
It has been an eventful year! 3Världen was launched, allowing customers to surf in 80 countries at the same price as in Sweden. Then, 3Samla was introduced, enabling all customers to add more users to their subscription. Last but not least, Tre became the first in Sweden to launch a public 5G network.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena has been renamed 3Arena. With our strong passion for innovation, connectivity, and experiences, we will contribute to developing the arena and the area.
  
  

Roger Häggkvist | Contact Person

title: Sustainability Officer
description:
På Tre är vi inte bara stolta över att vara ett av Sveriges mest innovativa telekombolag, utan också en arbetsplats där hållbarhet är en självklarhet. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva vårt arbete framåt som Sustainability Officer.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Som Sustainability Officer blir du en central del av vårt hållbarhetsarbete och spelar en nyckelroll i att driva våra ambitioner framåt. Ditt ansvar inkluderar att säkerställa att vår hållbarhetsrapportering uppfyller aktuella lagar och standarder, inklusive CSRD. Du kommer också att implementera och följa upp våra hållbarhetsmål, med fokus på våra science-based targets.
  
  

I rollen leder du insamling och analys av data kopplat till ESG och CSRD, både för internt bruk och extern rapportering. Du utvecklar och driver initiativ och processer som verkligen gör skillnad, samtidigt som du ansvarar för att ta fram vår årliga hållbarhetsrapport i nära samarbete med kollegor från hela organisationen. Som en del av vårt globala hållbarhetsnätverk inom 3Group får du också möjlighet att leda projekt och driva förändringar som bidrar till att skapa verklig och långsiktig påverkan.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

På Tre blir du en del av en arbetsplats där vi utmanar det förväntade – både i branschen och på jobbet. Här får du:
  
  

En unik chans att forma vårt hållbarhetsarbete.
  
En kultur som präglas av lärande och utveckling – här lär du dig något nytt varje dag.
  
Vara en del av en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place to Work.
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är analytisk och bekväm med att jobba med data och komplexa sammanhang samt är en strukturerad multitasker som trivs i en dynamisk miljö. Du har förmågan att ta egna initiativ och är självgående i ditt arbete. Vidare trivs du med att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och får där utrymme att vara en teamplayer.
  
  

Vi ser att du har en akademisk utbildning inom hållbarhet, ekonomi eller liknande. Du har flera års erfarenhet av hållbarhetsredovisning, ESG-analys eller liknande områden. Vidare har du koll på och behärskar CSRD och andra hållbarhetsstandarder med självklarhet.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Flexibla helgdagar och fem dagar extra ledigt per år
  
  

Hundzon & gym i 3huset
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Anna Papatziamos | Kontaktperson

title: Partner Account Manager till region Väst
description:
Inom Partner Sales på Tre har vi ansvar för vår företagsförsäljning via återförsäljare. Att leverera över förväntan och med viljan att vara bäst på det vi gör är en grundinställning hos oss. Nu söker vi en Partner Account Manager till vårt team!
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Som vår Partner Account Manager (PAM) ansvarar du för våra B2B-partners på regionnivå. I din roll säkerställer du att dina återförsäljare har rätt kompetens, motivation och förutsättningar att sälja våra produkter och tjänster till sina kunder i linje med våra mål och värderingar. Våra återförsäljare jobbar med butiksförsäljning, fältförsäljning och/eller TM-försäljning. Du hjälper dem att driva deras affärer mot slutkund och säkerställer en kundupplevelse i världsklass. Detta gör du tillsammans med respektive kontoansvarig (KAM) och övriga kollegor på Partner Sales. Du har både ett kort- och långsiktigt resultatansvar för din region och arbetar utifrån vår Tre-kultur som grund för att nå dina resultat. Tjänsten utgår ifrån region Väst och du har möjlighet att sitta på vårt Tre-kontor i Göteborg. Du rapporterar till Sales Manager.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

Vara med på en spännande resa driven av entreprenörsanda, utmanartänk och roligt säljarbete
  
På nära håll vara med och bygga upp samt utveckla affärsområdet
  
Utvecklas i din roll, tillsammans med härliga kollegor som stöttar varandra
  
Jobba på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser (jajamen, även 2025 har vi blivit utsedda till en av de bästa hos Great place to work)!

Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har en förmåga att bygga långsiktiga och goda relationer. Du drivs av att uppnå uppsatta mål och gillar att strukturera och prioritera ditt arbete på egen hand.
  
  

Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning inom telekom samt erfarenhet av ramavtalsförsäljning. Tjänsten innebär besök hos återförsäljare och partner, därav är körkort ett krav. Då nästan all kommunikation sker på svenska ser vi också att du talar och skriver svenska flytande. Du är van att arbeta med Excel och PowerPoint som verktyg i ditt arbete.
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från Tres försäljningssystem eller har sålt Tres produkter och tjänster. Det är också meriterande om du drivit försäljning via återförsäljare eller partners.

title: Leveranskoordinator till Tre företag
description:
Nu söker vi en ny kollega till teamet Leverans inom Business Delivery som har den viktiga rollen att implementera våra kunders växellösningar och ge kunden den bästa möjliga starten hos Tre.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

I Leveransgruppen arbetar du med tilldelade egna kundprojekt för att säkerställa att varje unik start och onboarding ska bli så bra som möjligt. Det gör vi genom anpassad och personlig kommunikation kombinerad med ett stort engagemang eftersom vi, liksom du förstår att varje kunds behov är unika. Du kommer ansvara för och planera dina egna projekt utefter våra förutsättningar och kundens önskemål tillsammans med både interna säljare och externa partners. Primärt fokus är på vår egen 3Växel och olika partner-MEX.
  
Våra introduktionsveckor för nya medarbetare ger en bra grund och de förutsättningar som du kommer behöva för att klara uppdraget.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

Få introduktion, utveckling och ständigt lärande på Tre
  
Bli en del av ett sammansvetsat team som stöttar och utvecklar varandra
  
Jobba på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser (jajamen, även 2025 har vi blivit utsedda till en av de bästa hos Great place to work)
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är relationsbyggande, har lätt för att knyta kontakter och tycker att det är rätt så skönt att arbeta målstyrt under fria former. Att jobba med egna projekt du själv har ansvar för är din grej! Är du dessutom en person som tar tag i saker när du ser ett problem eller vill lära dig när du märker att det är något du inte kan, är du definitivt en som passar in hos oss! Hos oss bidrar alla med en härlig energi, är inte rädda för att hugga tag i saker och har ett starkt mål och resultatfokus vilket vi tror att du också har!
  
  

Vi ser att du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, samt har grundläggande kunskaper i Excel likväl som övriga office-paketet. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom service och/eller telekom.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Varmt välkommen till Tre!
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Flexibla helgdagar och fem dagar extra ledigt per år
  
  

Hundzon & gym i 3huset
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Joakim Ekelin | Kontaktperson

title: Teamchef digitalisering och automatisering
description:
Teamet Customer Service Development befinner sig i en spännande resa att driva utvecklingen av kundupplevelse och digitalisering i framkant. Vi söker dig som vill leda ett av två utvecklingsteam, där du kombinerar en passion för ledarskap och digitalisering med kundupplevelse i fokus. Du kommer leda ett mindre, framstående krossfunktionellt team med produktutvecklare, specialister och frontendutvecklare, som bidrar till att vi tar nästa steg i vår digitaliseringsresa!
  
  

I din nya roll
  
  

Som teamchef är ditt främsta fokus att skapa rätt förutsättningar för att dina medarbetare ska verka till deras allra bästa förmåga. Av ledare på Tre förväntas ett tydligt och framåtriktat men samtidigt empatiskt ledarskap. Det är hos dig som vår anda och våra prioriteringar slår rot och lever. Då vi som team är på en ständig förändringsresa så förväntas du ofta leda i just förändring.
  
  

Vidare ingår det i rollen att ta ansvar över våra self-servicelösningar (internt som externt), inklusive chatbot och community. Målet är att öka användningen av våra icke-assisterade kanaler och förbättra serviceupplevelsen för våra kunder och användare, med fokus på enkelhet. Därmed kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva kvalitet och kundupplevelse kopplat till våra processer och system.
  
  

Du kommer även att identifiera förbättringspotential och driva automatisering genom att anamma ny teknik, så som Gen AI. Ditt uppdrag är att säkerställa att våra self-serviceprocesser är i toppklass genom att paketera datadrivna insikter och rekommendationer för att påverka andra avdelningar, i synnerhet IT och webbutveckling.
  
  

Du kommer se fram emot att
  
  

Vara del av ett team i framkant, med höga ambitioner och målet att bygga branschen bästa kundservice
  
Stor möjlighet att påverka contact centrets transformationsresa och kundupplevelsen för befintliga kunder
  
Vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, enligt Great Place To Work
  
Tillhöra en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, vi är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas och lyckas i rollen har du erfarenhet av att leda krossfunktionella team som skapar digital kundupplevelse och effektivisering. Du tycker det är kul att jobba och det ligger i din natur att föra över ditt engagemang till ditt team. Med intresse för närvarande och coachande ledarskap får du dina medarbetare att växa och utvecklas.
  
  

Du är van vid att ta datadrivna beslut med insiktsdrivna affärsmodeller och är duktig på att sälja in dina idéer. Du bör ha erfarenhet av konvertering, gärna från arbete inom e-handel, och kunskap om AI och digital utveckling/webbutveckling. Genom tidigare erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling, exempelvis som produktägare, liksom bred kunskap om SaaS-system har du förmåga att driva transformation genom produktutveckling. Genom din goda kommunikationsförmåga bygger du stort förtroende när du prestigelöst arbetar tillsammans med dina kollegor. Vi ser att du har en akademisk examen.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.

title: Customer Relations Specialist till Tre Företag
description:
Large Account Service på Tre Företag är vi som har i uppdrag att supportera Tres största företagskunder. Nu söker vi en ny servicestjärna till vårt team.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som vår Customer Relations Specialist tillhör du ett team vars vision är att bibehålla och utveckla affären där kundens och Tres bästa står i fokus. I teamet får du flera kollegor och en dedikerad Team Manager. I din roll som Customer Relations Specialist har du det övergripande drift- och förvaltningsansvaret för ett flertal större företagskunder. Utöver att förvalta din egen kundportfölj så supporterar du och dina kollegor övriga storkunder i deras dagliga ärenden.
  
  

Vad innebär detta mer konkret då? Jo, du är den som säkerställer att vi levererar den servicenivå som överenskommits i avtal med kund. Du utvecklar och underhåller rutiner och tar initiativ i syfte att öka kundnöjdhet. Vidare arbetar du med att löpande besvara kundernas driftfrågor via mail och telefon samt att du koordinerar och rapporterar uppkomna eskaleringar med en hög effektivitet och servicekänsla. I din roll ingår även att genomföra fysiska kundmöten ute hos dina kunder.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

Få introduktion, utveckling och ständigt lärande på Tre
  
Förvalta stora företagskunder och utveckla ditt administrativa arbetssätt
  
Bli en del av ett sammansvetsat team som stöttar och utvecklar varandra
  
Ha en plats på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser (jajamen, flera år i rad har vi blivit utnämnda till ett Great place to work)

Vem är du?
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du tidigare arbetat med service och administration i någon form. Du är duktig på att prioritera och är nördigt fokuserad på att saker ska bli genomförda i tid till deadline. Vi tror också att du är en skicklig relationsbyggare som har lätt att samarbeta samt skapa förtroende gentemot både kunder och kollegor. Vidare är du bra på att kommunicera i både tal och skrift, både på svenska och engelska, på ett professionellt och informativt sätt. Du har även grundläggande kunskaper i Excel. Slutligen är det här med att leverera service i världsklass något du bemästrar med trygghet.
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har teknisk förståelse/kunskap av 3Växel, Dynamics och Zendesk samt erfarenhet av att jobba mot större företagskunder.

title: Nya kollegor till Kundservice!
description:
Vi välkomnar nu dig som vill göra skillnad genom att leverera service i toppklass till våra 2,7 miljoner kunder hos Tre varje dag!
  
  

Du är viktig för oss!
  
  

Som Customer Representative på Kundservice spelar du en central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder. I din roll hanterar du inkommande samtal och tar hand om ärenden via mejl och chatt, både för privat- och företagskunder.
  
  

Tillsammans med ditt engagerade team arbetar ni för att hitta lösningar och skapa en positiv upplevelse för våra kunder. Genom att erbjuda professionell service och ett trevligt bemötande bidrar ni till att stärka vårt varumärke. Du får även möjlighet att utveckla dina kunskaper inom rådgivning och merförsäljning i en dynamisk miljö.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

En roll på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place to Work 2025! Vi är en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, och är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar.
  
En tillsvidareanställning på heltid med fast grundlön, provision samt månadsbonus.
  
Kontinuerlig utbildning och utveckling, tjänsten inleds med individanpassad introduktionsutbildning/onboarding.
  
En unik utbildning i kommunikationsmetodiken CXP, Customer Excellence Program.
  
En företagskultur vi är mycket stolta över!
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."

"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Mer om dig
  
  

Vi söker dig som vill göra vardagen enklare för våra kunder och bidra till att stärka Tre som varumärke. Du tycker om att hjälpa människor, är engagerad och trivs med att lösa problem. Vi tror att du är en lagspelare som gillar att lära dig nya saker och uppskattar en varierad arbetsdag.
  
  

Lite praktisk information
  
  

Du behöver vara över 18 år och kunna prata och skriva obehindrat på svenska och engelska
  
Tjänsten är på heltid med start under februari och mars månad.
  
Vi arbetar från vårt fina 3hus vid Globenområdet , Stockholm, mellan kundservice öppettider: mån - fre 08.00 – 18.00 och du kommer att schemaläggas utifrån bemanningsbehovet
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Låter det här som något för dig? Vad glada vi blir! Du ansöker enkelt och snabbt, inget CV eller personligt brev behövs. Vi ber dig istället att besvara urvalsfrågorna i denna annons och använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Flitiga som vi är, så jobbar vi löpande med vår rekryteringsprocess - så tveka inte att visa ditt intresse så snart du har möjlighet!
  
  

Vi utför en bakgrundskontroll på våra slutkandidater, du får mer information om detta under rekryteringsprocessen. Klicka här för att läsa mer om bakgrundskontroller.
