title: Machine Learning Engineer within Advisory and Analytics | SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you looking for a meaningful challenge and an opportunity to grow? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!*
**About Us**
 Join our vibrant Data Analytics ART team, which spans Stockholm and Vilnius and works within Google Cloud. We focus on gathering and providing datasets to support customer insights and enhance relationships and experiences. With your expertise, we can unlock even greater possibilities.
   

  

**Your role:**
 As a member of the Data Analytics ART team, you will:
   

  

* Develop machine learning solutions that drive customer insights and innovation.
* Utilize a diverse tech stack, including Git, Kafka, RESTful APIs, BigQuery, and Vertex AI.
* Apply best practices for continuous integration to manage GCP-deployed products.
* Design innovative technical solutions while engaging in workshops, hackathons, and tech guilds.


**Required Skills**
*Must-have skills:*
* A background in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent practical experience in machine learning or data analytics.
* Several years of experience in designing, implementing, and deploying ML models using GCP services like Vertex AI or BigQuery ML.
* Proficiency in Python and bash scripting for automating workflows.
* Proven experience in designing and developing scalable REST APIs for machine learning or data analytics applications.
* Familiarity with Terraform, Docker, and SQL for infrastructure and data management.
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines.
* Hands-on experience working in Linux environments.


*Nice-to-have Skills*
* Proficiency in test-driven development and creating a continuous testing platform.
* Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow for developing deep learning models.
* Familiarity with IT security principles, particularly in the context of ML pipelines and data storage.


 If you don’t meet every requirement listed but are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**Personal Attributes**
* Self-driven and enjoys tackling varied technical challenges.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Innovative, curious, and open to starting from scratch.
* A growth mindset, eager to learn and adapt in a rapidly changing technical landscape.


**What we offer:**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Access to SEB staff banking and exclusive benefits.
* A prestigious team with experienced colleagues who value cooperation and openness.
* Opportunity to share knowledge by pair programming, demos, etc.
* A workplace where we care about the work-life balance.
* An innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Hybrid Workplace Setup
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


 Our fundamental belief is that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in, or where they come from.
   

  

**Welcome with your application.**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application already today but not later than the 30th of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Rasmus Hallberg, Talent Acquisition Partner at Rasmus.hallberg@seb.se .

title: Consultant Engineer. - Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**About Neo4j**
 Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.
   

  

 At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.
   

  

 Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
   

  

 As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
   

  

**As a Consulting Engineer, You Will Do The Following**
* Working with our customer's engineering teams, you’ll lead and contribute to all phases of the Neo4j implementation within their projects, from inception to roll-out
* Act as the Technical Subject Matter expert for short to long-term consulting engagements where you’ll work hands-on with the Neo4j products, provide expert advice and guidance, train and educate, and help prepare deployments for production roll-out.
* Develop solution architectures that address the technical requirements of our customer’s projects
* Design and build prototype solutions that demonstrate required functionality with Neo4j
* Help prepare solution proposals for our customer’s engineering and management teams that help address the overall project goals.


**Job Requirements**
* Extensive experience with database technologies and data modeling concepts (preferably using big data and/or analytics technologies)
* Minimum of 3+ years of experience designing and developing enterprise-class applications
* Knowledgeable in the Java ecosystem
* Hands-on development experience using API’s, messaging and middleware
* Experience with complex data analysis and passionate about solving technical data problems
* Experience working in an agile environment and DevOps experience
* Experience in a consultative role, with complex, customer-facing projects
* Capable of mentoring and educating small groups
* Demonstrated ability to work independently or within a team environment.
* Comfortable with learning new technologies and development languages as needed
* Great listening skills and attention to detail


**Nice To Have**
* Industry vertical experience in Financial Services, Retail, or Telco
* Programming languages: Java, Python, C#, JavaScript
* Graph DB-related experience i.e. with Neo4j, MySQL, Oracle, Spark, Databricks, OrientDB, TitanDB or similar
* Familiarity with Couchbase, MongoDB, Marklogic, Teradata or similar
* Experience in Visualization (D3, Sigma.js, Linkurious, Sawyer)


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor Degree required
* Ability to work independently, self-directed, and remotely in a cross-functional organization
* 5+ years working in a consultative capacity in a Professional Services Organization
* Able to travel up to 50% of the time, on occasion outside of the dedicated region


 Location:

title: Seniora konsulter inom infrastruktur
description:
**Kompetensen vi söker** 




 Till vårt team i Stockholm behöver vi engagerade konsulter inom infrastruktur som vill bidra till att bygga vårt samhälle.
 



  





 Vi söker följande kompetenser:
 


* produktionsledare
* byggledare
* byggplatsuppföljare
* besiktningsmän
* experter inom väg och anläggning
* experter inom energiutbyggnad
* experter inom processindustri och kärnkraft



  





 Eftersom vi startar upp verksamheten inom infrastruktur i Stockholm behöver du vara drivande, ha ett stort kontaktnät och stimuleras av att bygga upp någonting nytt. Vidare har du ett starkt självledarskap och är en driven positiv problemlösare som vågar fatta beslut.
 



  





 Vi tror också att du lockas av samhällsaspekten av dessa viktiga projekt, där du verkligen kan göra en skillnad för framtida utveckling.
 



  





 Vi ser gärna att du har minst 10 års erfarenhet inom ditt kompetensområde.
 



  





 Kunderna kommer utgöras av både entreprenörer och beställare.
 



  





**Om STHK** 




 STHK är ett växande expertföretag byggt på mjuka värderingar och övertygelsen att om våra medarbetare mår bra kommer detta även att gagna våra kunder. Vi har en platt organisation och det personliga inflytandet över din arbetssituation och utveckling är stort. Vi uppmuntrar innovation, personlig utveckling och spridning av kunskap. Vi är självständiga men hjälper varandra. Och vi ser till att ha kul på vägen.
 



  





**Vad får du av oss?** 




 Vi erbjuder olika lönemodeller för att passa just din situation. Vi har en provisionsbaserad lönemodell som ger dig en frihet att styra över din egen tid, utveckling och inriktning. Du disponerar en del av din inkomst i en pott som kan användas för till exempel utbildningar, mässor och teknisk utrustning. Din månadslön kan sättas utifrån ditt uppdrag samt beläggning.
 



  





 För dig som lägger större vikt vid en förutsägbar månadslön, har vi även en fast lönemodell.
 



  





 I ryggen får du ett nätverk av kompetenta och trevliga kollegor med olika erfarenheter och kunskaper. Vi tror på att om våra anställda mår bra, kommer det gagna att hela företaget och våra kunder. Därmed är det även viktigt för oss att träffas och ha trevligt tillsammans. Detta görs i form av olika träffar såsom konferensresor, klassiska aws, föreläsningar med mera.
 



  





 Dina medarbetare består inte bara av STHK utan även av vår finska partner Welados internationella team. Detta samarbete accelererar och skapar möjligheter för intressanta uppdrag och ökat kunskapsutbyte.
 



  





**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?** 




 Förutom att du naturligtvis är kunnig inom ditt yrkesområde vill vi att du delar våra grundläggande värderingar som du kan se på bilden. Andra personliga egenskaper vi håller högt är prestigelöshet, pragmatism och att man är en lagspelare.
 



  





**Hör av dig!** 




 Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan nu! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor kring rollen.

title: Är du Centrics nya 3rd line supporttekniker?
description:
Till uppdrag hos flera av våra kunder i Stockholmsområdet söker vi nu efter erfarna 2nd line tekniker som nyligen tagit nästa steg i karriären och idag arbetar inom 3rd line support. Vi söker efter dig som till vardags trivs med avancerad problemlösning i Windowmiljö och som vill fortsätta din IT-karriär hos oss på Centric.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som 3rd line supporttekniker är du användarnas och dina kollegors räddare i nöden! Du tar emot ärenden som eskalerats i organisationen, från 1st och 2nd line. Med detta sagt kommer du förmodligen stöta på nya, spännande och komplexa ärenden varje dag. Det kan exempelvis röra sig om nätverksrelaterade problem och systemfel i kundspecifika miljöer. Du kommer arbeta med teknisk support i Windowsmiljö samt arbeta med felsökning, förvaltning och enklare drift av Windows Servrar.
 



  





 I och med att arbetsuppgifterna är varierande beroende på hos vilken kund du hamnar så kan det även innefatta hantering av virtuella maskiner, så som VMware och HyperV.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är en person som drivs och motiveras av utveckling! Att arbeta strukturerat och lösningsorienterat är ditt ledord. Du ser övergripande på komplexa problem och med hjälp av ditt analytiska tänkande har du förmågan att kunna isolera orsaker, utveckla och använda metoder som tar dig vidare i din felsökning. Du komminucerar mycket väl på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Vidare är du en flexibel person som uppskattar teamarbete likväl som du själv tar ansvar och driver fram lösningar hela vägen till mål!
 



  





*Krav* 



* 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom support
* Relevant utbildning inom IT
* Erfarenhet av felsökning och förvaltning av Windows Server
* Paketering av applikationer i SCCM
* Felsökning av nätverk
* Djup kunskap i Microsoft365
* Azure/Intune



  





*Meriterande* 



* Linux
* Hantering av virtuella maskiner, HyperV / VMware
* Administration av databaser



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Partner Account Director
description:
**Location: Remote - Stockholm, Sweden**
 The Channel Account Director will be responsible for executing our channel and alliance strategy in the Nordics and Benelux. You will be managing our partners and creating pipeline by identifying opportunities to drive closed won revenue.
   

  

**Onwards Together!**
 Illumio, the pioneer and market leader of Zero Trust segmentation, prevents breaches from becoming cyber disasters. Illumio protects critical applications and valuable digital assets with proven segmentation technology purpose-built for the Zero Trust security model. Illumio ransomware mitigation and segmentation solutions see risk, isolate attacks, and secure data across cloud-native apps, hybrid and multi-clouds, data centers, and endpoints, enabling the world’s leading organizations to strengthen their cyber resiliency and reduce risk.
   

  

 Illuminate the future with Illumio and join a team that’s passionate about developing cutting-edge security solutions that protect the world's most critical assets.
   

  

**Our Team's Vision:**
 Our Sales team is comprised of high-performing, motivated individuals driven by a relentless pursuit of growth and excellence. We understand that true success is measured by the meaningful impact we make on our customers' businesses. That’s why we invest deeply in both personal and professional development to ensure our team members have the tools and opportunities they need to excel.
   

  

 By joining our agile Sales team, you will collaborate with industry-leading professionals who are passionate about pioneering Zero Trust Segmentation.
   

  

**Your Impact:**
* Exceed assigned quota - including new license subscriptions, support, subscription renewals and professional services from new and existing accounts.
* Build a healthy pipeline of new and expansion channel opportunities.
* Be responsible for partner recruitment, on-boarding, management, education and execution of Illumio programs within territory.
* Build and implement technical and sales readiness plans for the territory.
* Play a key role in guiding tactics around channel direction, including planning and implementing territory business objectives.
* Evaluate and manage new strategic business opportunities, initiatives, partnerships and/or alliances.
* Proactively lead the joint partner planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets and critical milestones associated with a productive partner relationship.
* Drive programs to ensure that partners and customers are well informed about upcoming events, campaigns, promotions and communications.
* Proactively assess, clarify and validate partner needs to maintain high partner satisfaction ratings.
* Serve as the first line of escalation for handling channel conflict and dealing with related business issues.
* Conduct channel market analysis and monitor competitive activity in territories.


**Your Toolkit:**
* 8+ years’ experience in channel management
* Cyber security and/ or network security experience
* A proven record of accomplishment in sales and Partner management
* Excellent knowledge and experience of working within reseller, systems integrator and consulting ecosystems
* The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth and rapidly changing environment
* Experience in delivering presentations, and enablement training
* A willingness to travel


**Our Commitment:**
 Illumio believes that an environment of unique backgrounds, experiences, viewpoints, and individual contributions drives our success and makes us stronger together. We are dedicated to creating and maintaining a diverse culture and emphasizing inclusion and belonging.
   

  

**Benefits:**
 At Illumio we offer a wide range of benefits to our eligible team members. Our benefit programs vary by location and can include Medical, Dental, Vision Coverage – Health and Dependent Savings Accounts – Life and Disability Programs – Paid Parental Leave – Voluntary Benefit Programs – Company Sponsored Wellness Program – Wellness Reimbursement Program - Retirement Savings – Equity Opportunities – Paid time off and Paid Holidays – Employee Incentive Program.

title: Engineering Manager - Site Reliability Engineering
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead one of our core platform teams, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery, technical product, and cross-team collaborations. Collaborating closely with the team, neighbouring teams, and Staff Engineers, you’ll drive critical infrastructure that impacts the entire company.
 



  





 You’ll guide a collaborative, inclusive, and high-performing team that thrives on shared decision-making, knowledge-sharing, and fostering a psychologically safe environment. Your role will include refining team processes, building and prioritizing backlogs, clarifying requirements, and engaging with stakeholders across the company. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach.
 



  





**How You Will Make An Impact** 



* Lead and grow a high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Drive infrastructure excellence by ensuring the platform is scalable, reliable, and optimized for fast, efficient product delivery.
* Partner with other teams and stakeholders to align the platform’s development with organizational priorities and technical goals.
* Enhance team processes by refining workflows, prioritizing backlogs, and clarifying technical and product requirements to maximize efficiency and impact.
* Shape the vision for the platform’s future, inspiring the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Solid technical background with expertise in modern SRE practices and cloud technology.
* Proven experience managing and growing SRE teams.
* Extensive understanding of technical platforms, team dynamics, software delivery and system design.
* Ability to foster a psychologically safe work environment for your team.



  





**It would also be music to our ears if you have** 



* Experience with technical product development, focusing on Developer Experience.
* Hands-on familiarity with tools and technologies like Go/TypeScript, GKE, Terraform, Observability stacks, and CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions).



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.

title: Automotive Thermal Systems Engineer
description:
**For our client we are looking for a Automotive Thermal Systems Engineer. Our client is looking for a candidate that has the ability to calibrate, tune and test Thermal Control functions using standard industry tools such as INCA. The testing activities are to be performed, ideally, in a vehicle environment so hands on experience will be very welcome. Experience with function development in Simulink is highly desirable – the SW is developed using Model Based SW development techniques in Simulink.**


### **Assignment Description**


* In-vehicle Testing, calibration and verification of thermal control functions using standard industry tools such as INCA and CANalyzer.
* Model based software implementation of Thermal Control software using Simulink (please see competence and other requirements).
* Participate in the cross functional system work.
* Simulink models.
* Validation and verification activities.


**Requirements**


* Calibration experience using INCA.
* Testing experience using industry standard tools e.g. Vector CANalyzer.
* Driver’s License B – as testing is required in a vehicle environment.


**Other Requirements**


* Diagnostics experience particularly in a development capacity; developed or experienced with diagnostics in a modelling environment, not just using diagnostics tools desirable.
* Function development in Simulink – Thermal and/or climate experience is highly desirable.
* System development lifecycle experience.
* SW development lifecycle experience.
* Data analysis using Python is desirable.

title: Machine Vision Engineer
description:
Northvolt has an exciting job offer for two Machine Vision Engineers to join our Industrial Automation team in Skellefteå.


You will collaborate with a cross-functional group of experts from automation, control, materials flow, factory design, software engineering and machine learning to design and implement software systems which allow us to implement a highly automated production process, collect complete data from both manufacturing and battery systems, and develop innovative applications which optimize our processes and products.



This is a greenfield project in a complex field, which requires a combination of proven technologies and design of new innovative solutions. We believe you are a person who is highly motivated by solving problems and taking pride in your area of expertise.


**Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* You will build and employ a variety of tools for visualising, debugging, and validating various layers in the vision pipeline.
* You will compose algorithms to process massive amounts of manufacturing data for inline and offline processing.
* Develop, test, and deploy state of the art software systems for automation, data collection and machine learning applications
* Collaborate with a cross-functional group of experts across the company to make sure we build the right things together for the right reasons
* Keep up with the state of the art in software, distributed systems, and engineering processes, as well as develop more domain knowledge in related areas (among others, automation, battery manufacturing and connectivity)

Qualities that we cherish are flexibility, sense of quality, friendliness, motivation to take on new challenges, grit and a sense of humor.



Apply with CV and cover letter or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Skills & Requirements


* Degree in Electronic/Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or similar.
* 3+ years experience in industrial high-pace environment
* Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals and ability to apply them toward manufacturing process development.
* Expertise with the most common vision and measurement systems: Cognex, Keyence, Teledyne, Dalsa, Basler, LMI Technology, etc.
* Practical knowledge of cameras, lenses, optics, lighting, and other image capture and processing.
* Experience C/C++ and Python. Experience with real-time systems and generic programming is highly desirable.
* Familiar with communication protocols like EtherCAT, Profinet, TCP/IP, and I/O.
* Analytical and statistical data analysis skills.
* Experience in document preparation and presentation (Trial report, action plan, new project presentation, etc.).


Great Place to Work


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Wellness grant


4 semaines de vacances / 4 weeks of vacation


Journées maladie illimitées / Unlimited sick days
company_description: Northvolt is a supplier of sustainable, high-quality batteries. The mission is to build the world’s greenest battery, with minimal carbon footprint and the highest ambitions for recycling

title: Automation Engineer
description:
Northvolt has an exciting job possibility for an engineer specialized in the field of Automation.


You will be contributing in your area to building one of the first European battery factories which will play an important role in the design and development of the large-scale battery factories, which will help the transformation to a carbon-free society.



You will be part of the engineering team improving and maintaining the factory automation system.



You will be working intimately with the design team to design and implement a highly automated production process. You will also be working intimately with the Software Engineering Team, responsible for the higher-level systems such as MES, ERP and PLM. The production environment has very high demands on cleanness, up-time to reach the set quality level, production efficiency and traceability. It will require a combination of proven technologies and the design of new innovative solutions. We will work with the best solution providers globally.



In general, you have a long experience in the field and have been driving large, innovative and challenging automation projects with very high demand on accuracy and scale.



Specifically, you have a deep understanding and hands-on experience in integrating very diverse, complex, equipment into higher automation layers developing some of the most advanced control systems in the world. You work symbiotically with the Plant Design and Manufacturing Engineering teams, translating their inputs into crisp specifications and orchestrating the execution in an ecosystem of external suppliers and their own developers.


**Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Develop, maintain and implement the automation system in the factory.
* Commissioning of new equipment.
* Fault finding as part of the maintenance procedure.
* Work together with the Industrial Automation System Design team to test and verify upgrades and test applications.
* Identify and interact with key automation solution suppliers.
* Be part of the team that will give our operations team the tools to run the most advanced and efficient production factory in the world.
* Author and review Engineering Design Documentation (Requirement specifications, Functional design, Logic diagrams, Test Cases, Test Records).
* Implement, test and commission systems in the aforementioned technologies.
* Participate in R&D activities for piloting of new technologies and their suitability to production environments.
* Participate in education and knowledge transfer workshops.
* Cost estimations for projects and change requests. Provide input for quoting and planning works.
* Code review and test of other’s work as well as improving and defining code review practices.
* Participate in and contribute towards design forums and improvement meetings for technical improvement and optimization of software processes.


Apply with CV and cover letter or your complete LinkedIn profile.


**Application and CV must be submitted in English.**

**Education/Experience**


* Degree in Electronic/Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Computing, Software Engineering or similar.
* 3+ years experience within Industrial Automation in process-driven industries such as: Mining, Paper Mill, Semiconductors, Fine Chemicals, Pharma, Food etc.
* Experience with sensors and instrumentation
* Experience with PLC/SCADA, especially Siemens, Beckhoff, and ABB 800xA.
* Experience in OPC connectivity and MES interfaces

Experience in writing technical documentation (Requirement specifications, Functional design, UML, Test Cases, Test Records)  
*

* Highly organized and result-driven
* Proactive and goes beyond expectations
* Passionate about solving complex problems with technology in a simple yet innovative way
* Track-record of successful implementation of advanced automation systems in relevant industries
* Development of control system architecture
* Design, implement and testing of PLC code delivering desired system functionality.
* Good experience working with servo drives and motion technology
* Must have worked in multi-cultural environment
* Excellent English written and oral skills, Swedish is a plus.

title: Open Source Robotics Engineer
description:
**Make Rerun even better for the robotics community**
=====================================================


At Rerun, we’re building a new multimodal data stack for Physical AI. Large parts of the physical-world economy will be transformed by these technologies, and we're building the data infrastructure and tools that enable it to happen. Rerun’s open source project focuses on visualizing and handling multimodal logs and is already loved by some of the best teams in the world. We are an open core company, so most of what you’ll build with us will be open source, directly benefiting the robotics community.


We’re looking for a passionate, self-directed **Open Source Robotics Engineer** who deeply empathizes with roboticists’ needs, and loves to both build and engage the community. Your mission will be to make Rerun more approachable and useful to the robotics community through building integrations, end-to-end examples, tutorials, and other educational material.

**What You’ll Work On**
-----------------------


As an Open Source Robotics Engineer at Rerun, you’ll:

* Build and own Rerun’s coming **ROS 2 bridge** and related tools.
* Build and maintain integrations to other robotics projects like **LeRobot, Nvidia Isaac Sim**, and **MuJoCo.**
* Build cool and educational robotics examples and tutorials that show how to use Rerun to get more done faster.
* Engage with and grow the open-source robotics community around Rerun, and interact with our customers.
* Add robotics features and plug-ins to the core Rerun project.

**We would love if you have**
-----------------------------

* A high-agency ownership driven mindset. You make things happen and if you see more needs to be done you do that too.
* A helpful attitude and a bias towards communicating with and bringing along the community.
* **At least 2 years of professional experience** working with real robots (more experience is great, but drive and ability are what we value most).
* Strong **Python skills,** and a good foundation in both **C++** and **Rust**
* Real-world experience with **ROS 2** and an understanding of its nuances.
* Cool robotics projects to show off and a track record of online communication.

**Nice-to-Haves**
-----------------

* Contributions to open-source projects related to robotics, computer vision, machine learning, or data visualization.
* Familiarity with machine learning, MLOps, and modern imitation and end-2-end learning approaches in robotics.

**How we work at Rerun**
------------------------

* We're a remote company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.
* We meet up in person for a week roughly once a quarter
* The team you'll join currently has members in European and US-east timezones


	+ Everyone is available for synchronous work between 1:30 and 5pm CET
	+ This is a new sub-team so for the right candidate we are open shifting this sync-time window to better accommodate the US west coast
* We've put together an uncommonly talented tech team, value agency and helpfulness highly, and expect everyone to take broad responsibility for what they build
* We offer competitive cash and equity compensation, six weeks paid vacation, and whatever hardware and software you need to do your job


If you’re passionate about robotics, open-source, and love bringing complex data to life, we’d love to hear from you!

title: System Verification Engineer, HiL
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About the Role:**
-------------------

  

Are you passionate about testing, verification, and challenging complex systems? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy problem-solving with cutting-edge technology? We’re looking for a Verification Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and managing our verification environment (DSpace Toolchain), writing test specifications, creating test cases, and analyzing results to ensure the highest quality of our software in a Continuous Integration framework.  

  

You will work closely with development engineers in Vehicle Motion Management, collaborating across multiple teams and contributing to the evolution of innovative solutions in automotive technology.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Develop and maintain our virtual verification environment, including DSpace Toolchain.
* Write test specifications and create detailed test cases.
* Perform testing and analyze results to verify software quality in CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaborate with Vehicle Motion Management engineers and cross-functional teams to ensure thorough verification.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of testing processes, integration, and automation frameworks.
* Occasionally travel for business-related purposes.
**Qualifications:**
-------------------

  

* Master's degree (or equivalent) in Engineering (Electronics, Mechatronics, Mechanics, or Physics).
* 7+ years of experience in the automotive domain.
* 5+ years of experience in software development or verification of vehicle dynamics, motion control, driver assistance, or automated driving features.
* 3+ years of experience with Hardware-in-Loop (HIL), Software-in-Loop (SIL), or Model-in-Loop (MIL) environments.
* Experience in vehicle-level verification activities and working with simulation tools like Simulink.
* Proficient in Python programming.
* Knowledge of continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD) processes.
* Familiarity with source control systems (e.g., GIT, Team Foundation Server).
* Knowledge of DSpace Toolchain or similar environments.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.
**What we offer:**
------------------

  

* An exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge automotive technologies.
* A collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development in a leading industry.
* Occasional travel to broaden your experience.
* A chance to make a tangible impact in the field of automotive simulation and verification.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------

  

Apply Now! If you are a motivated, detail-oriented engineer with a passion for automotive technologies and testing, we want to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of the automotive industry!


Last application date: 16th February


Available positions: 2

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
AVL MTC Motortestcenter AB offers a job in Sweden (SE) as
**Senior Test Engineer**  


AVL in Sweden is now looking for a motivated test engineer within transmission for our engineering department in Haninge. We have customer projects and assignments within all areas of automotive testing, Electric Drive Systems, ICE, Environment and Development.  

  

AVL takes part in a wide range of projects within Hybrid, Electromobility and other areas in the automotive industry. AVL MTC has approximately 200 employees based in Stockholm and Gothenburg. As an engineer at AVL you will work with cutting edge technology in collaboration with experts in the global AVL team and our successful customers. You will be working at our Tech center in Stockholm. You may also be working as a Resident Engineer at our customers in the Stockholm area.  


**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:**  


* Handle and operate testing of components for electrified transmissions / powertrains
* Handle customer requests and ensure their satisfaction
* Develop test methodologies
* Ensure data quality
* Participate in and take lead in test object inspections
* Lead the team to perform testing activities
* Develop and improve existing methods and guidelines, and stay up to date with most recent technology findings within the field of drivetrains
* Problem solving and detailed root cause analysis
* Technical support for customer projects as well as internal projects
* Working in international project teams, in cooperation with different AVL departments, in direct contact with our customers

  



**YOUR PROFILE:**  


* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Automotive, Mechatronics Engineering or similar experience
* Minimum 4 years of work experience, within testing (component or systems)
* Well organized and enthusiastic team member that can work independently, guide your colleagues, and lead the work forward
* Excellent communication skills
* Fluent speaking and excellent writing skills in English (Swedish is meritorious)
* Willing/able to travel
* Driving license

  



**WE OFFER:**  


* Be part of our pioneering team– together with our customers we shape the future of mobility!
* Competitive Compensation Package
* Collective Agreement and insurances
* Working in close cooperation with our unique in-house test lab
* International and innovative collaborations – integrated in our global AVL expert network
* Mobile working, flex-time and modern new offices in Liljeholmen and Haninge are part of our DNA.
* We support lifelong learning and challenging projects: gain more knowledge in projects and trainings, apply your knowledge and get creative.

  



**Interested?**  

If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL! We look forward to receiving your details.

**Check out our step-by-step guide**

title: Senior Solution Engineer - SWE
description:
**Senior Solution Engineer, Sweden**
====================================

  

  

*This is your unique opportunity to take on a customer-facing engineering role where you will deliver and implement tactical communications systems and IT solutions. Are you on the outlook for a role where you can apply your broad technical skillset?*  

  

**Truly international – proudly Danish**  

Systematic was established in 1985, and has since grown to more than 1100 people, working across three core business areas: Digitalisation, Healthcare & Defence. This means that every day, more than a million people worldwide use our solutions. Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish, and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters the most.  

  

**Customer-facing engineering role**  

As Systematic in Sweden, are currently ramping up in our Defence business area, we are on the lookout for a Senior Solution Engineer. The role includes, to take on the leading role of delivering SitaWare and Iris suites for Defence customers, primarily in Sweden but can differ depending to the project.  

You will be working closely with multiple customers, rolling out a mission-critical system that creates value by simplifying decision-making, and where we need our solutions to work, when it matters the most. Your focus will be to ensure, that our products are installed and are operational while ensuring that our product suite, interacts accordingly with the support from the rest of the Systematic organization. Beyond providing technical support and advice both on-site and back office, your key tasks will include:  

  

* Design, implement and support technical solutions
* Perform acceptance testing
* Conduct technical training for our customers – both in classroom environments and in workshop set-ups
* Provide first and second-level technical customer support on our solution


  

Furthermore, you will be responsible for coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, subcontractors, consultants and colleagues at Systematic. Finally, you will stay up to date on the capabilities of Systematic products to ensure alignment of customer expectations to provide maximal value for the customers.
Your place of work will be at our office in central Stockholm, Sweden, and you should expect some travel (usually 2-4 days at a time) servicing your customer sites in Europe depending on the project.

  


**Customer-centric with a broad toolbox**

We hope that you can recognize yourself in the statement that, you are eager to contribute to a successful team while developing and applying your strong and wide-ranging technical skills to deliver value to the customers.  

Additionally, you bring some years of experience from a similar role combined with a technical educational background.


We also expect you to be able to identify yourself in the following:  

  

* a customer-centric mindset and preferably experience interacting and engaging with customers directly
* experience within one or more of the following areas: tactical communications systems, IT infrastructure, software and system testing and/or test management), software development
* experience with technical training
* a strong communicator with professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


  

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects.  


**Never stop developing**


At Systematic there is room to be professional and personal and we encourage our employees to be continue and share their knowledge across sites. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong. We invest in the further development and education of our Systemates. This is why we never stop developing.

  

  

**Start your development here**  

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant.  



**Get in touch**


**Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen**

title: Byggkonstruktör/Disciplin lead
description:
**Join an exciting journey towards a green industry with COWI**  

We are now seeking a **Structural Engineer** who is passionate about developing sustainable technical solutions for our clients in the building and industrial sectors.

**WORK WITH US IN STENUNGSUND**


Together with our clients, we are driving the transition toward a greener industry. To support this mission, we are looking for a Structural Engineer to join our team. Our department in Stenungsund consists of approximately 60 colleagues, including piping designers, project managers, installation supervisors, electrical and automation engineers, building inspectors, and structural engineers. Our key clients operate within petrochemicals/refineries, energy facilities, and pulp and paper industries.  

Using digital tools, we frequently work remotely with clients and other COWI offices. Through our expertise, we support our clients in meeting today’s industry standards. Our projects often involve comprehensive commitments, spanning all stages from feasibility studies, basic and detailed engineering, and procurement to construction management, inspections, and final reviews.

**YOUR ROLE AS A STRUCTURAL ENGINEER**


Your primary task is to provide expertise within the structural engineering discipline for our industrial clients’ projects. We engage in both small and large-scale construction projects across all phases, from feasibility studies and detailed design to procurement, construction management, and final inspections.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design foundations, structural systems, and develop calculation models, focusing on concrete structures
* Dimension other structural elements within stabilizing systems or as required by our clients
* Work with both 2D and 3D tools and advanced calculation software.
* Primarily handle concrete and steel structures, including designing solutions and detailing
* Participate in early project phases by selecting structural systems and performing preliminary calculations
* Conduct analyses using 3D modeling and perform detailed calculations in later stages.
* Collaborate closely with colleagues across disciplines to deliver optimal results for our clients

**WHO YOU ARE**


To succeed in this role, you should thrive in a collaborative, development-oriented environment where professionalism is highly valued. You are motivated by maintaining strong client relationships and enjoy engaging with various stakeholders.

**You will need**

* A Master’s degree in Structural Engineering or similar
* At least five years of experience as a structural engineer specializing in concrete and steel structures
* Proficiency in calculation software, such as FEM-Design, Mathcad, and WIN-Statik
* A strong interest in client relations and collaboration
* A driven, goal-oriented, and analytical mindset
* The ability to work across multiple interfaces and collaborate effectively both internally and externally
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English


We also believe you are interested in growing into a specialist or project management role. You value a culture of development, humility, and camaraderie and collaborate well with diverse individuals.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

**YOUR COMPETENCE. OUR TEAM. SHAPING THE FUTURE TOGETHER.**  

Your expertise is key to our success. At COWI, we work across disciplines and industries, sharing knowledge and building strong relationships with clients and colleagues. You’ll bring your expertise to the table while learning from the best.


Our employees are our greatest asset, and they make our projects successful. At COWI, you’ll have a unique opportunity to grow your potential and contribute to shaping tomorrow’s society. Together with your manager, you’ll develop a plan for your growth while building your expertise daily in both local and global projects.


Our office is centrally located in Stenungsund, close to train and bus connections.

**QUESTIONS?**


Contact Group Manager Niclas Kristensson at +46 70 756 4271.


  
**Application deadline**


28 February 2025**Recruitment type**


Full-Time, Regular**Country**


Sweden**Location**


Stenungsund**Req. ID**

title: QA Engineer / Video editor
description:
**Combined Role:** QA Engineer / Video EditorTime split: 90-95% QA and 5-10% Video Editing for marketing material
  
About CheckProofCheckProof is a leading digital platform enhancing maintenance, health, safety, and quality operations. With over 300+ B2B clients worldwide and usage across 38 countries, our solution streamlines complex processes.
  
Our app is powered by a cross-platform framework built with Ionic and based on Angular and TypeScript. Our robust admin platform is based on EmberJS (JavaScript), Angular Elements (TypeScript), and Angular Material, while our REST API is developed in PHP (Laravel) and Java microservices.
  
The Opportunity
  
As we expand our development and marketing team, we're now looking for a combined role as QA Engineer / Video Editor to join the team.
  
This unique position offers an exciting mix of responsibilities:
  
**90-95% QA Engineer:** Ensuring the quality and performance of our web applications through manual testing, automation using Cypress, and close collaboration with developers.
  
**5-10% Video Editing:** Creating high-quality video content for marketing purposes, including product demos, feature highlights, and promotional materials.
  
  

**QA Engineer Responsibilities:**  

**Manual Testing:** Perform manual testing to ensure safe releases of upgrades and new functionality.
  
**Automated Testing:** Develop automated test scripts using Cypress, a JavaScript-based testing framework, to verify the functionality, performance, and reliability of web applications.
  
Write end-to-end tests, integration tests, and UI tests to cover key user flows.
  
  

**Collaboration:** Work closely with developers and QA teams to identify bugs early in the development process and ensure smooth CI/CD pipelines.
  
**Test Maintenance:** Maintain and update test suites as the application evolves, ensuring all features are thoroughly tested.
  
**Best Practices:** Implement best practices in test automation, ensuring tests are efficient, reusable, and stable in a fast-paced Agile environment.
  
  

**Video Editor Responsibilities:**  

Create engaging and visually appealing marketing videos, including product demos, feature tutorials, and promotional content.
  
Edit raw footage into polished videos using tools such as Adobe Premiere Pro or similar video editing software.
  
Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure videos align with CheckProof's brand and messaging.
  
  

What You'll Bring
  
**Experience:** At least 2 years as a QA Engineer, with a proven ability to deliver high-quality testing solutions.
  
**Technical Proficiency:** Experience with Cypress and JavaScript.
  
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines.
  
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
  
  

**Video Editing Skills:** Basic experience in video editing using tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar software.
  
**Communication:** Fluency in English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  
**Adaptability:** A willingness to learn and quickly adapt to new technologies and frameworks.
  
  

What We Offer
  
**Impactful Work:** Take on a pivotal role in a dynamic team, driving key projects and decisions.
  
**Personal Growth:** A commitment to your development with continuous opportunities to learn and upskill.
  
**Empowerment:** Autonomy in your technical choices and equipment.
  
**Innovative Culture:** Be part of a culture that's all about innovation and staying ahead in technology.
  
  

**Position Details:**  

**Location:** Täby, Sweden
  
**Type:** Full-time (100%)
  
**Start:** Immediate
  
  

Don’t let this opportunity pass you by! Reach out and let’s explore how your skills and passion align with the exciting journey at CheckProof.

title: Project Manager
description:
We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.
  
  

This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm
  
You will report to the Engineering PMO Manager
  
Start date after agreement but as soon as possible
  
  

**Tasks and Responsibilities:**  

Create project plans and budgets for product development projects to meet goal and objectives.
  
Secure resources (personnel and financial) to finalize project on time and in accordance with specification.
  
Manage change requests associated with the product development.
  
Lead and secure the quality work for your projects under research and development and those projects currently under launch throughout the business.
  
Hold and document meetings with customers within the projects.
  
Work with continuous improvement related to project (management) and process execution.
  
  

**Qualifications and Experience:**  

10+ experience in project management with proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.
  
Worked at a company developing complex products with both hardware and software.
  
Worked at a company that has its own production/assembly factories.
  
Experience collaborating cross-functionally with different business stakeholders and team members
  
Experience of full life-cycle projects
  
Experience in active risk management and mitigation plans execution.
  
  

At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
  
Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.

title: Senior Test and Verification Engineer
description:
Would you like to take part in transforming healthcare? Qbtech is the global market leader in professional ADHD tests, providing tests that are both CE-marked and FDA-cleared for use as an aid in the assessment and treatment evaluation of ADHD for people aged 6-60. Our vision is to transform healthcare by providing a complete system of leading objective tests, products and services that empowers clinical and financial decision-makers to improve outcomes and support patients to better understand their symptoms and treatment.
  
Qbtech operates in 14 countries, with offices in Stockholm, London, and Houston. We are investing significantly in new products, technologies, and people to create an ecosystem of solutions for providers, clinicians, and patients.
  
About the role
  
As a Senior Test and Verification Engineer, you will join a cross-functional team using agile methodology to develop medical software applications. You’ll drive quality assurance through testing and verification, collaborating with back-end developers and product owners. Your work will support continuous integration, ensuring our products meet requirements and design standards.
  
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

Review system and software requirements.
  
Develop and execute manual and automated test cases for web-based applications.
  
Build automation test suites for frontend web applications.
  
Perform test planning and support release activities.
  
Create and maintain test artifacts, such as specifications and reports.
  
Write clear problem reports to identify root causes and help prioritize fixes.
  
Documentation - such as test reports, and formal reports that require signatures.
  
  

Who are you?
  
You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy sharing knowledge with your team. You also need to possess strong communication skills that enable you to navigate seamlessly between teams, ensuring smooth collaboration. In addition to your interpersonal strengths, you hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field, with at least five years of experience in software testing and verification.
  
  

**Key qualifications include:**  

Familiarity with safety-critical software development.
  
Experience with creating automation testing frameworks and CI/CD pipelines.
  
Knowledge of web-based testing and tools (e.g., Mabl is a plus).
  
Strong programming skills and a deep understanding of testing concepts.
  
Experience with non-functional testing (e.g., security, performance, maintainability).
  
  

Having an ISTQB certification and experience in full-stack automation testing is considered a plus. Programming skills, particularly in Java and Kotlin, are also meritorious.
  
  

What can Qbtech offer you?
  
At Qbtech you will have the opportunity to work with something meaningful that helps people understand ADHD while transforming healthcare. You will work in an international environment together with some of the leading experts in the world. You will lead the development of best in class as well as first in class products and services – globally. There are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow and to expand into other technologies within the company. Qbtech also offers education and certifications in fields that are relevant to the technology used within the company.

title: Engineering Manager - Accounts
description:
SEB Embedded is on a mission to push the boundaries of financial services through banking-as-a-service. We are a business unit within SEB with separate governance, ways of working and approach to tech. Our goal is to win in the battleground of fintech utilizing our strong banking fundamentals from SEB including expertise, capital and banking license giving us a unique opportunity to disrupt ourselves and the rest of the banking industry.
  
  

About the team
  
The team is responsible for the microservices and APIs related to accounts. This includes things like account onboarding and offboarding; transaction handling; different types of accounts and their logic including things like interest calculation, account balance; financial reporting; and more. These APIs are used both internally by other teams in our domain, such as when creating card purchases, as well as by our customers. The team consists of backend engineers and one quality engineer with a dedicated product manager.
  
  

What you will do
  
In this role you have an important part in fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment, by coaching and mentoring the team members. As Engineering Manager you will ensure that the team is set up for success, supporting them to reach deliverables as well as enabling effective collaborations and professional growth.
  
  

**As Engineering Manager you will:**  

Coach and mentor engineers in the team, setting them up for success in delivery as well as supporting the professional growth of the team members.
  
Drive innovation, collaboration, and an inclusive, healthy team culture while reinforcing Embedded values.
  
Lead and take part in initiatives cross-teams to improve overall performance, collaboration and delivery.
  
Adapt to changing priorities and needs, guiding the team through any challenges that arise.
  
Together with the team, owning the full lifecycle management for the product/service portfolio.
  
Development of services and products, and guiding the team in 3rd party integrations.
  
Together with the full team articulate the team goals and how they align with business objectives.
  
Lead and enable the team rather than doing; focusing on deepening your skills in coaching and helping others expand their capacity
  
  

Who you are
  
You showcase adaptability and helpfulness, and as Engineering Manager you’ll be part of fostering a culture that welcomes innovative solutions in the team. You will lead the engineers through your accountable, challenge-ready, and collaborative approach. In the role you also need to have an open mindset and see the potential for failure as a pathway to progress.
  
  

**To succeed in this role you have:**  

Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with different stakeholders and collaboration partners.
  
An interest in supporting others in their growth journey, coaching and mentoring.
  
An innovative and flexible mindset, enabling you to support the team when encountering new challenges.
  
Previous experience delivering projects to production, as a software developer or in a similar role, giving you the ability to anticipate challenges.
  
System designing skills.
  
Bonus if you have experience working with Thought Machine or a similar 3rd party ledger.
  
  

Application
  
We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Project Manager
description:
We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.
  
**Location:** Stockholm
  
  

**Tasks and Responsibilities:**  

Create project plans and budgets for product development projects to meet goal and objectives.
  
Secure resources (personnel and financial) to finalize project on time and in accordance with specification.
  
Manage change requests associated with the product development.
  
Lead and secure the quality work for your projects under research and development and those projects currently under launch throughout the business.
  
Hold and document meetings with customers within the projects.
  
Work with continuous improvement related to project (management) and process execution.
  
  

**Qualifications and Experience:**  

> 5 years of project management experience in a fast-paced environment
  
Worked at a company developing complex products with both hardware and software that has its own production factories
  
Experience in collaborating cross-functionally with different business stakeholders and team members
  
Experience of full life-cycle projects
  
Experience in active risk management and mitigation plans execution
  
A track record of collaborating with steering groups and other stakeholders
  
**Possesses at least one of the following:** M.sc or B.Sc. in Engineering
  
  

Who are you?
  
Strong project management skills with proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  
Deductive reasoning/ Analytical skills
  
Proactive and anticipate needs before an emergency erupts
  
Ability to manage up, down- and sideways
  
You are passionate and pragmatic with a genuine technical interest
  
You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
  
You are a great team player
  
  

**How to apply:**  

Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.
  
At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
  
Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Administratör med inriktning mot forskarutbildning, Vikariat
description:
Vill du arbeta i en internationell miljö där utveckling och samarbete står i fokus? Vi söker nu en vikarierande administratör till vår forskarutbildning då vår medarbetare går på föräldraledighet.  

  

**Information om avdelningen**  

Institutionen för data- och informationsteknik är en integrerad institution mellan Göteborgs universitet och Chalmers tekniska högskola AB, belägen på campus Johanneberg och campus Lindholmen i Göteborg. Institutionens verksamhet omfattar högklassig forskning, utbildning och nyttiggörande inom områden som AI & machine learning, software- & hardware engineering, computer science, security, network & systems. Organisationen består av knappt 300 anställda med en hög internationell sammansättning med individer från 50 olika länder. Ytterligare information om institutionen finner du på: Institutionen för data- och informationsteknik.  

  

Den administrativa verksamheten vid institutionen är gemensam för både Chalmers och Göteborgs universitet och leds av en administrativ chef och en biträdande administrativ chef. Vi möter dagligen studenter, lärare och övriga anställda som vi ger ändamålsenlig och professionell service till. På avdelningen arbetar totalt 30 medarbetare som ger kompetent stöd inom ekonomi, HR, kommunikation, studievägledning, utbildningsadministration, intern service m.m.


**Beskrivning av tjänsten**  

Som forskarutbildningsadministratör kommer du att administrera utbildningsärenden inom Data- och informationstekniks utbildning på forskarnivå. Arbetet innebär medverkan i, och utveckling av, arbetet i hela utbildningskedjan från antagning till disputation.



Du kommer bland annat ansvara för beredning av antagnings- och disputationsärenden samt utformning och uppdatering av information på webbsidor för doktorander. I samråd med den administrativa koordinatorn för utbildning på forskarnivå utveckla och uppdatera administrativa processer och rutiner. I rollen ingår också administrativt stöd för ledningen av utbildning på forskarnivå på institutionen. Ett flertal administrativa system för hantering av dessa processer finns till hjälp i arbetet. Rådgivning och information till befintliga och potentiella doktorander ingår som en naturlig del liksom nära kontakt med de inom fakultet som är inblandad i utbildning på forskarnivå.


**Anställningsform**  

Tidsbegränsad på heltid tom: 2026-05-01  

  

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som har:


* Minst gymnasieutbildning, gärna högskoleutbildning.
* Flera års erfarenhet av administrativt arbete, gärna inom statlig verksamhet.
* Erfarenhet från universitet eller högskola är starkt meriterande.
* God datorvana och kunskap i Officepaketet (krav). Kunskap i Ladok och andra relaterade system är meriterande.
* Du måste kunna kommunicera väl på både svenska och engelska då vi verkar i en internationell miljö.


För att lyckas i rollen bör du ha ett genuint intresse för människor och trivas med att samarbeta. Du är självgående, serviceinriktad, noggrann och flexibel, med förmåga att planera, prioritera och hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt.



Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet och förmågan att utveckla och effektivisera det administrativa arbetet.


**Att arbeta på Chalmers**  

Chalmers värdeord: öppenhet, respekt, delaktighet, mångfald och kvalitet, genomsyrar synen på vår arbetsmiljö och våra medarbetare. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsplats i en akademisk miljö, där studenter och medarbetare drivs av att skapa värde för en hållbar framtid.
  

Våra förmåner för anställda omfattar bland annat:  

* Flexibilitet att arbeta på distans med hänsyn till verksamhetens behov.
* Friskvårdsbidrag samt en friskvårdstimma varje vecka under betald arbetstid.


Här kan du läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att arbeta på Chalmers.  

  

**Ansökningsförfarande**  

Ansökan ska vara märkt med namn och dokumenten sparas som PDF-filer enligt nedan:  

  

**CV**  

**Personligt brev**  

* 1-2 sidor

**Övrigt (valfritt)**  

* Eventuella intyg, betyg etc. Referenser lämnas vid en eventuell intervju.
  

**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-02-03**

  

**Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta**  

Anna Engkvist, Administrativ Chef CSE,  

Anna.engkvist@chalmers.se, 031-772 64 71



Jenny Andersson Vaughan, Biträdande Chef CSE,  

Jenny.andersson.vaughan@cse.gu.se, 031-772 65 31

  

*\*\*\* Chalmers undanber sig alla erbjudanden om ytterligare jobbannonsering eller rekryteringsstöd i samband med denna rekrytering.* \*\*\*

  


  

*Chalmers tekniska högskola i Göteborg forskar och utbildar inom teknik och naturvetenskap på hög internationell nivå. Universitetet har 3 100 anställda, 10 000 studenter och utbildar ingenjörer, arkitekter och sjöbefäl. Med vetenskaplig excellens som grund utvecklar Chalmers kompetens och tekniska lösningar för en hållbar värld. Genom globalt engagemang och entreprenörsanda skapar vi innovationskraft, i nära samarbete med övriga samhället.*  

*Chalmers grundades 1829 och har än idag samma motto: Avancez – framåt.*

title: RF Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We are seeking a dedicated RF Engineer to design and develop RF systems and subsystems.



The RF Engineer’s responsibilities include reviewing system requirements, selecting RF equipment, designing RF circuits and systems, and performing system tests.



Our ideal candidate has extensive knowledge of radio frequency technologies, testing equipment, and procedures.



They are familiar with RF simulation software and have a strong understanding of RF principles and theory.



Ultimately, the role of the RF Engineer is to design and develop efficient, high-quality RF systems and subsystems that meet our company’s needs and comply with industry standards and regulations.



Responsibilities


* Design, develop, and test RF systems and subsystems.
* Analyze and interpret system requirements and customer specifications.
* Select RF components and equipment based on system requirements.
* Conduct system simulations to evaluate design options and risks.
* Perform system integration and validation tests.
* Document and maintain RF design specifications and procedures.
* Provide technical support to customers and other team members.
* Stay informed about new technologies and advancements in the field of RF engineering.
* Comply with industry regulations and standards.

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Proven work experience as an RF Engineer.
* Strong knowledge of RF systems, components, and testing procedures.
* Experience with RF simulation software and tools.
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively with other engineers and team members.
* BSc degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related field.
* Professional Engineer (PE) certification is a plus.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



As a person, you are social and have a great interest in technology. You are self-motivated, driven and meticulous in your work. As a consultant at Sigma, it is also important to have a good understanding of the customer's wishes and the possibilities of the technology.



### **WE OFFER**



We offer an opportunity to be part of building a company at the forefront.


* A flexible working day
* High individual confidence
* A forward-looking organization
* We are driven by new ideas and development
* Good benefits
* Annual activities and conferences

*Sigma Industry Evolution AB is a technology consulting company in product and production development with a focus on Mechatronics, Electronics and Embedded Systems. The combination of long industry experience, great commitment, internal and external assignments and close collaboration between Sigma's various operations in the region creates a unique cross-industry greenhouse for engineers. With diversity, participation and entrepreneurship, we strengthen and develop our business and our employees.*



### **MORE INFORMATION**

fredrik.grahn@sigma.se

title: SW Verification & Test Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker en erfaren och kunnig mjukvarutestare inom inbyggda system att ansluta sig till vårt team. Som mjukvaruutvecklare är du ansvarig för att designa och utveckla testfall, genomföra manuella o automatiska tester hos en av våra kunder. Du kommer att arbeta nära intressenter för att förstå krav, anpassa funktionallitet och tillhandahålla teknisk support.



Som konsult hos oss är vanliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Samarbeta i teamet hos kunden för att samla funktionskrav för att sedan utveckla testfall.
* Erbjuda teknisk kompetens och support, felsöka problem och optimera prestanda.
* Skapa och upprätthålla teknisk dokumentation.


Områden där våra kunder arbetar:


* Autonoma fordon
* Electromobility (elektrisk drivlina)
* Connectivity (uppkopplade fordon/enheter)

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Civilingenjörsexamen i robotik, mekatronik, inbyggda system, datavetenskap, eller relaterat område. Alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet som mjukvarutestare.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta självständigt eller som en del av ett team.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att samarbeta effektivt med kunder och teammedlemmar.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i skrift och tal.
* Ett plus är även certifiering inom ISTQB

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Hos oss blir du välkomnad av glada och hjälpsamma kollegor. Vi har roligt på jobbet, högt i tak och ett engagerande klimat. Du står aldrig ensam inför en utmaning utan kan bolla idéer och hitta möjligheter tillsammans med dina kollegor. Vi tror på att samarbete är nyckeln till framgång. På Sigma Industry Innovation har du möjlighet att samarbeta med experter från olika teknikområden och utbyta idéer i en stödjande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Vi investerar i våra medarbetare och erbjuder kontinuerlig utveckling och utbildning. Här kan du ständigt växa i din karriär och bredda din expertis.



Sigma Industry Innovation är ett entreprenörsdrivet företag med stora visioner och korta beslutsvägar, vilket ger goda möjligheter att påverka såväl din egen som företagets framtid. Vill du bli expert inom ditt befintliga område, växa in i ett nytt eller engagera dig internt på Sigma? Möjligheterna är oändliga och hos oss får du allt i ett: en trygg anställning, en stimulerande vardag och en skräddarsydd framtid. Vi tror på att trivas på jobbet. Hos oss skapar vi en positiv och rolig arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och arbetsglädje är i fokus. Kom och gör skillnad med oss!


### **WE OFFER**



**Tack för att du har läst vår annons!**



Vi hoppas att du känner dig nyfiken på oss och vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan och ditt CV. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan **redan i dag.**
